text: This is some of the freshest, best tasting food - and you will crave it.   The staff - ask for Abner- is friendly and attentive. My favorite is the "soup on the side" but too frequently I have company and it's not a great sharing dish. The curry is great - and go spicy - it's a tollerable heat.  One more advantage - good wine list, all bottles just $20. Enjoy one of my favorite spots.

I'm serious about soup; so much so that I eat it in 100F.  There's something so comforting and relaxing about it. 

Went on a Friday at 6:30pm and it was pretty empty, so we got sat right away by a very friendly server. 

Ever since I tried Pho Ga at Noodles Ranch in Old Town, I've been trying to find a place just as amazing mostly due to location. I've tried two others in Mesa off Dobson rd. NOTHING has topped it yet. Here's why...

Pho Dalat's beef based broth was very tasty; I'll give them that, but there wasn't much chicken. Other then the usual add-ins provided with Pho, the soup consisted only of shredded chicken breast pieces and noodles. At NOODLES RANCH the Pho Ga comes with bright greens of broccoli and baby bok choy. 

I'll continue my quest for a nearby pho place !

What can I say... this place was PHO me ;) Fast friendly service, average pho prices ( I paid $7 plus $2 for my drink) and the atmosphere was very laid back but the staff were professional. The music wasn't overwhelming, which is something I always dread when trying a new place. I ordered the #8 Pho which included meatball, beef, tendons, sinews, and other parts I was unsure of but was completely delighted by their chewy and jello like textures in my mouth. I'm a texture person. The flavor was awesome as well. The noodles were perfect. Long, thin, and chewy. I had looked them up before going and saw they only took cash unless you spend over $15. If I had not known that before going I wouldn't have stayed for lunch and would've been angry at not having my pho fix.  I will deft be coming here again.

This is a hidden little gem in the area.  The food is very flavorful, the ambience is very comfortable and private, and the service is impeccable.  I have only tried the Bun dishes, but they have been excellent, and the dishes that my dining companions have selected have looked very delicious too.  The iced coffee, is of course, awesome as well. Definitely a place I'll be visiting often!

Minus one star for having those hungry big fish in that tiny fish pond at the entrance. Thats cruel guys. They look miserable. And having a big amazing meal and looking at that makes my heart melt.

Coming to the food: Amazing food ! if for some reason you have a choice, pick this one and go ! Amazing Pho! Its all in the broth? the, very well done ! Pick thai coffee for dessert if you like milky sweet coffee.

I am impressed with the food and service here.  

I was initially looking to enjoy some delicious Korean food, but the place that I wanted to visit were closed on a Sunday.  I then opted for Vietnamese food.  I am rather new to Arizona, but have visited Saigan Pho in Tempe area twice thus far with my room mate, but wanted to try a different place.  

I walked in and was seated right away.  I am not going to lie, when I first arrived the parking lot was almost fully empty, with just one SUV parked in front, which made me a little skeptical.  I walked in to find just one couple eating their food.  The aroma coming from the kitchen welcomed me and as soon as I opened the menu, I knew that they were serious about their Vietnamese food.

I ordered the fresh shrimp and chicken spring rolls, which come with a delicious peanut sauce. 

My main order was of the seafood Pho which consisted of big delectable shrimp, squid, fried fish cakes, and crab meat (imitation, but still yummy) in a rich and flavorful pork broth.  I wanted to try something different, so I chose the yummy pork broth, as opposed to the normal beef broth.  I also had them combine two different types of noodles for me, ramen and clear ones.  The combination of the various flavors and noodles, really enhanced the meal.  I also enjoyed a cold Sapporo beer, which for happy hour was only $2.00.

I love their happy hour prices for appetizers and beers.  I will be back for more happy hour deliciousness at Pho Da Lat. 

BTW, I went to wash my hands before I ate and the bathrooms were beautiful and clean and the waitress was very attentive and sweet.

I think I may have my next East Coast foodies event here.  THe prices are amazing, the food is delicious and plentiful, and the ambiance is welcoming.

I'm the pho specialist. I am so picky when it comes to eating pho at restaurants. In terms of good pho in Chandler, I cannot complain much about this place. I always get a rare beef pho, and it's not bad.. The price is reasonable, service is prompt, and the soup is great. Location is good. Best after hangover. I will definitely be coming back.

This is one of my favorite places to eat at but today I experienced the worst customer service possible. I was at the door to pick up my lunch. When I first walked in no one was behind me but after a crowd began to form. One of the waitresses looked past me and started seating everyone else behind me, 3 separate parties. After she seated each party. She then walked right past me and still refused to acknowledge me. She didn't even check to see if anyone else had assisted me. After a few more minutes a different waitress ended up getting my order. I will not be back there.
Really like this place.  Good, clean, and good customer service at fair prices.
Sadly it is going downhill. More like a 2.5 star place. Soup is lacking flavor, vegetables aren't fresh, place aren't as clean as it used to be. We are exploring other pho places now...

Pho is delicious!  Haven't found any really great pho in scottsdale so this was such a great find as we've been missing some authentic Pho.  Hubby had the vermicelli bowl which he thought was delicious as well.  Really happy we found this place.

Man pho was bad yesterday. I hate to rip on my people but they need to step it up. Noodle tasted like one of those instant pho from Lee Lee's supermarket and was extra soggy. I could have sworn the "special combination" was a lot better last time. The fatty piece they added into the special combination tasted weird. Won't be coming back anytime soon until I see better reviews.
I liked this place! The food was good! I would rate it with 5 stars because this is probably the best in Tempe Area, however I had been in better places. Overall, I really really like this place.
The meat in the chicken and beef pho was overcooked and dry. Service was slow, had to flag down our waitress, who was busy on her cell phone, to get her to help us.
This is nice place for pho. The staff is very friendly, and the restaurant is pleasant and clean. Also, the wine prices are awesome - $6 per glass of some pretty good labels.

I have eaten here several times and food has always been very good, while service was adequate. However, on my most recent visit, my mannish "waitress" was brusque, unhelpful, and downright rude. I will not return, despite living only a block away.

Was excited to find a pho place near Costco on I-10, since I shop there semi-weekly. I live in Laveen, which is not close to any pho--and I LOVE pho. I typically go to Glendale or north Phoenix for pho. I have tried almost every pho place in Phoenix, and this one would have been an excellent addition to my rotation because of where they are located. Despite the two stars rating I would go back to Pho Du Lat again if I am ever shopping at Costco or Total Wine, and having a craving for VIetnamese---however---let me be clear that it is only because of the location. But I'd be complaining about how much they charge for what I get AND the lack of some very important essentials. So, if you want an EXCELLENT pho place to try--THIS ONE IS NOT IT. Let me explain.

The restaurant is a good size and clean. Bathrooms are clean. Service is fine. Not spectacular, but basically good. You can get in and out for lunch in a reasonable time. The staff is lackluster, though. Let's just say unenthusiastic, okay?

I ordered a dry noodle dish (I chose egg noodles) that came with fish ball, pork, chicken, beef ball and shrimp. I ordered it because it comes with the pork broth on the side, and the entree has a *spicy* star next to it, and I like spicy dishes.

The server asked me on a scale of 1-5 for hotness. I chose a 4. So...let me tell you what I got....
I got an unusually small serving of food. A small portion of egg noodles that were cooked fine (but sticky, which is common, so I had to use my broth to separate them--not a big deal), but the meat was so freaking skimpy. There was a fish ball a little bit smaller than the diameter of a quarter. The beef ball was somewhat bigger, and cut in half. There were two medium/small shrimp (the menu says "jumbo"--but they aren't remotely jumbo) and there was a few strands of bland, boiled/rubbery flavorless chicken and two tiny, thin pieces of pork. The meat sat hidden under the small portion of noodles and on top was a smattering of ripped up romaine lettuce. The broth, as advertised, came on the side. The broth was good, and contained the grilled shallots. This dish cost $8, but you or I would have spent about 99 cents making it, if that. The heat level was around 1 or 2 at most. I had to request chili/garlic paste----and she returned with a meager tablespoon in a small dish.

There were NO herbs...No cilantro. No limes or lemons. No fresh, cut jalapenos. No fresh, chubby bean sprouts. NONE of the tables had any garlic/chili paste, spoons, chopsticks, etc.

My solo lunch included iced tea and an order of vegetarian spring rolls. The spring rolls were pakced tightly with romaine and lacked any herbal flavor. The sauce was primarily fish hoisin sauce with crushed peanut in it. I much prefer a thick peanut based sauce with chili flakes. This stuff was okay, but not what I prefer...

The total cost (NOT including tip) was $15.09. WAY TOO EXPENSIVE FOR LUNCH. That being said, if the food was outstanding and worth driving to, I'd have happily paid $15 for it. It was NOT THAT GREAT. It was...MEH.

i love it. I am Vietnamese and i live long time in US. I love this place. It is sweet and nice. The taste is authentic and the best i ever tried in Tempe and Phoenix. It is better than some places near Asian market. Pho is the best and spring roll is awesome. 

I wish this place closed to my house then i can eat it some time a week. It is not cheap like the ones near ASU, but you get what you pay, it is 1-2 dollars more for bowl of Pho, but taste way better. It a little noisy on Sat after 9pm, as they have karaoke, other than, it is great. The size of lunch is smaller than dinner size and price is different too. I like the lunch size better, as i can eat the other appetizer.

I was not impressed. I ordered the vegetarian pho, and the broth was so-so, the tofu wasn't fried and was in giant hunks, it seemed like most of the vegetables were canned (baby corn, water chestnuts, and mushrooms), there were maybe three piece of broccoli, which I wish there was more of, and the bok choy was way over-cooked. Definitely not a place I will go again.

On the plus our waitress was very nice, and the wine is very inexpensive, although that didn't make up for my unappealing pho.
Moved here from Orange County recently, and although it isn't as good as my usual SoCal spots, it's definitely good for Arizona.
Good pho and atmosphere but service was too slow. I waited for almost 45minutes for my pho...

To start, our server was quick and on the ball! The salad rolls (garden rolls) were fresh, but too minty for my taste, but my boyfriend said he really like the heavy spearmint flavor that they had. Peanut sauce can be hit or miss, but their sauce was pretty good. Seemed like it had a smoked hint to it. 
As for the Phò we had, so tasty. Not over oily broth, a lot of meat, and just the right amount of onions. I also like the portions of bean sprouts and peppers they bring for the phò. It wasn't a huge heaping pile that you feel like you are wasting by not using. 
Looks like they have karaoke on the weekends or something. That along with their wine collection could make quite the pho-king experience.
Delicious food at reasonable price! #14 of the Pho Soup is bomb.

I've been here a few times. I really like the #39. I went with some coworkers once who were all jealous of my #39. Today, we ordered out and got an order of spring rolls, a #9 rare pho and #39 grilled chicken and rice. The spring rolls were a pretty big disappointment. They were soggy (but they were to go), kinda chewy (too chewy) and they came with fish sauce I'm not a huge fan of. My grilled chicken and rice also came with fish sauce. I would prefer something else and I know you can ask for peanut sauce instead. The pho was good (as I was told) but nowhere near as good as khai hoan. They recently did some remodeling. Overall, it's pretty good and I would recommend it to someone looking for a spot in this area to get Vietnamese.

I eat here a couple of times per week. Always tell myself not to come back. However, it's the closest pho to me. This time was the last for sure. 

Food is ok. Summer and garden rolls are ok but small. Pho is ok. Skimpy on meat.  Spring roll with lettuce wrap is great. 

Service is indifferent and forgetful. Sometimes food takes a while. 

Biggest annoyance is the $0.45 charge if you're paying with credit card under $15. Build the cost into your food and don't piss off diners with a trivial charge. 

I'm going to drive further to get my pho fix from now on. 

Again. Nothing bad. But just ok is not good enough.

Nice decor, so-so food.  Probably the most bland pho I've had in the Valley.  Nothing particularly negative about it - except of course bland pho is fairly negative.  The menu selection is also fairly limited compared to every other Vietnamese place I visit (Da Vang comes to mind, but who can compare with them?).  I'm going to go try a  few other selections and am keeping my fingers crossed they warrant an upgrade to 3 stars.  But can't do it based on the pho alone.

Went there for lunch and was not my first visit.  Was not greeted by the server just ask how many in party.  I asked for a booth, server attitude very poor.  After being seated no greeting just stood there with pen and pad.....really?  I ordered spring rolls and bun bo hue soup.  Food was good but the empty appetizer plate and eaten soup bowl sat on my table.  No follow up for how meal was.  Even had to ask another employee for water.  Such disgust.  As a Vietnamese I consider this place catering to white type folks. I only said this because there was a white family that was sat behind me.  Omg server was as pleasant as can be.  Oh please.   Prices are high and portions are small.   My money is spent better elsewhere.

This place is pretty okay! It's not a place I'll make a special trip to, but if I'm in the neighborhood and I'm craving some pho, I might stop. 

Service could definitely be improved.  It wasn't very full and we had to wait quite a bit. Bit slow, courteous but not friendly, if that makes sense. Moreover, the waiter forgot my husband's tea with our order. We ended up just leaving it that way, we just made sure it wasn't charged at the end. 

The food had good flavor, but it wasn't particularly fresh. We both had chicken pho. There wasn't anything particularly special about the food here. 

One thing I didn't like at all was that they had large fish in a tiny little pond by the entrance, which is awful, poor things. 

Also, by our table, there was this (adult) guy putting his bare feet on the booth seat and touching them.  I'm not sure if there's anything the management could have done about that, but it was definitely gross, especially in an eating establishment.
Yummy! I enjoyed the pho and my friend enjoyed the bun. I know it was very nice inside.

I used to love Pho Dalat when they served fuller bowls of cold rice noodles, with oodles of grilled meat and peanut seasoning, complimented with crunchy salad greens and tangy fish sauce. Gone are those days when the waiting staff were shy but politely chatty and regular visitors were acknowledged. Now the prawn or meat in a bowl of Bun has dwindled, smart but precise waiters have been appointed and the prices have been hiked along with the number of discount -announcing advertisements in local newspapers. I sincerely wish that this restaurant finds its footing once again because it has always had quite a few things going for it, like good quality food, quick service and some great ambiance.

Our favorite waiter left the restaurant about a year ago and since then, the service is really crappy to the point now where I have to update my review. Before he left, He told us that the other waiters felt like we were bad tippers and he was surprised to hear that because we always gave him a big tip. We didn't take offense to him telling us this because he knew that we use to wait tables before and our tip is solely based on the service we receive. He even backed us up and said that if they want a better tip from us- they have to learn how to give good service.

My update isn't about the food much because I still think the food is good and we visit this restaurant time to time just for it. Kudos to the chef! The bun bo hue is delicious!!

What I would like to express to the staff and management at this restaurant is that, if you expect your customers to tip well, you must first provide good service.


For example, if you drop off the food and never check back on your customers until they flag you down for the check and water, do you believe that you've earned your tip simply by taking an order and delivering the food? I know some waiters believe that there is justification for giving bad service if the  customer is a bad tipper--but let me tell you, if this is your understanding of customer service, you may want to find another job. 

I almost want to give the staff here a free lesson on how to be attentive to their customers and what good service is all about if they get butthurt over tipping. 
As a waitress, I had customers who actually followed me restaurant to restaurant. As a customer, I enjoy getting to know the wait staff and try to be as easiest customer. 

Now, yelp readers must be wondering how bad of a tipper my husband and I are if the wait staff labeled us cheap. For shitty service we still give 10% because we've waited tables before, however, our tipping is usually above 20%.
Love, love this place! Best Chicken Pho! Also try the fried rice and the crystal chicken. Prices are reasonable and it's clean!

I have been going to this restaurant for a few years. The staff has always been consistent, friendly and professional. 

The lunch pho prices are insane. In a world of over processed food, this place keeps it simple and tasty. 

Cant wait to get back!

I used to love eating here til yesterday. I will NEVER come back. Our server doesn't speak English well, poor service by her, brought us food without plate n silverware, never check on our water refill. Hire English speaking worker goodness.

My experience was terrible especially because of the manager and the mindless waiter. I ordered a stir-fry noodle and he came back with soup noodle. I told him this was wrong and he returned the food and asked me to specify on what i wanted again and I did, and he came back with the wrong sh*t again. This time it was even nastier because it looked like they didn't want to waste the previous soup and somehow extracted the liquid to make the "sauce" and just added different noodles! The color of the "stir-fry" looked exactly like the color of the soup that i returned!! I tried it and then it tasted so SWEET LIKE THEY USED FISH SAUCE (NUOC MAM)!! WHICH IS WRONG!!! I was even more frustrated when the manager came out as if i was in the wrong! she was like "ok, what do you want!" showing me the menu. I had it and didn't order anything else because the service was terrible and the food was even WORSE!!! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. (THERE IS MORE I WOULD ADD BUT ILL END IT BY SAYING IT IS THE WORSE VIETNAMESE RESTAURANT AND FOOD EVER)

Love this place you can get veggie pho with veggie broth and they do have other vegan options as well as Omni options. The service is super fast and the staff is so nice. I never have to ask for a water refill they just automatically bring water sometimes without me even noticing.
Excellent food and the staff was extremely friendly. Pleasant experience all around.
Went here for lunch and got the Pho which is always good.  This is convenient to get in and out of quickly and they give good service.  The food quality always seems consistent.
Second Time I Been In the Last 2 Weeks Good Food, Will Like To Try A Few More Things On The Menu.. Will Go Back

I live here, and all the servers are great.  I'm here 1-3 times a week, the Spring rolls are to dir for and the Pho is fantastic loaded with noodles and Veggies, great way to get a hot an healthy meal.  The place is always packed for lunch, so come early or for a late lunch.  My favorite is the #35 Spicy Beef Vermicelli, I only can handle the 3 out of 5 on the heat scale.
We like the Pho Special...I don't really know how authentic the place is but we like to dine-in and carry out from here about once a month.
This place is OK. One of the waitress isn't nice at all. The price is good!

I've been here a few times for the pho and spring rolls. It was good enough to bring me back the first few times, but the last time I went (this past winter) the pho was a huge letdown. Not sure if it was an off day or they were running out of broth because it was late, but it was very bland. I probably won't take another chance on this place since I know of at least a few other places that consistently serve good pho.

Fantastic vietnamese food. The staff is very friendly and attentive.
The pho dalat, bun bo hue, and mi la kai are must haves.  The pork and shrimp rolls and the roast quail are perhaps the best I've had anywhere.

I have only had the Pho here, but it was really good. Flavorful broth, not too salty, with high-quality and fresh ingredients. I like to get the rare beef and tendon, and the beef is very tender, and they give a good serving of tendon. Someday I'll try some other things from the menu, but the Pho noodle soup is so good I just keep getting the same thing.

One of the better Vietnamese places I've been to in AZ.  

The place is oddly named, though -- they're really not a pho shop, at least not in the sense of what I usually see at similarly named restaurants here in OC.  Their pho really isn't even all that good, but the rest of their dishes are usually quite tasty.  The look and feel of the restaurant is also decidedly more upscale than your average pho restaurant.  

They've got a good variety of dishes, and everything that we've tried  (other than the pho) has been very good.  In an area where there's relatively few good Vietnamese restaurants, it's definitely worth a try.

Solid Pho, Basil Rolls are pretty good.  You do have to ask them to bring out the basics (chopsticks, fish sauce, garlic pepper paste, etc).  But overall, yeah, it's a decent joint for those cold Pho days.  Clean facility, friendly staff.
Super fast service! We ordered shrimp vermicelli and chicken pho soup. Both had excellent flavor. Shrimp was cooked and seasoned perfectly.
Good food and great service! Prices are agreeable and the portions are generous and honestly some of the best asian food I've had so far!
Used to love this place but new staff isn't friendly and forgot my shrimp. I went in alone so hate know what they'd forget if it was multiple people. Pho was good

My First Vietnamese restuarant , we ordered veggie rolls first and then i ordered fried rice with chicken. Taste was good and different.  Though rice was lot dry. One thing i liked was they came frequently to ask  if everything is fine and if we need anything else. I will definitely go again to check some other dish.
Awesome Vietnamese food!  I tried the delicious signature pho and roasted duck, egg noodles soup. Affordable for all the family dine in.

Totally impressed by this place. Food was incredible... As good as Cyclo without the wait. We had the shrimp bun and the rare steak pho, both were great! Server was excellent and we never had to wait for anything. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!!

Bits of PLASTIC IN MY FOOD!! DISGUSTING!!! NO NO NO NO!! This restaurant MUST BE SHUT DOWN!
Towards the end of my meal I realized there were small bits of plastic in my hot soup (aka. pho). As a polymer scientist and engineer, I could tell it was either polyetheylene or polystyrene of some sort... either way these polymers may dissolve in hot water, are carcinogenic (cause cancer and other disease) and are very oxidating against DNA. Batches of Pho soup are made all at once in large quantities.. these bits of plastic were dissolved in EVERYONE'S SOUP! 
Then people ask themselves how they get sick??????? Because of unhealthy restaurants that are somehow legally operating and selling people poison. They should have at least added "polystyrene" in the list of ingredients on the menu, so people at least know they're being served plastic!

Most likely we will not come back to this place.  Pho broth tasted like plain water with some salt added to it.  
The vegetarian vermicelli dish was a rip off.  Only had a few pieces of tofu.  

The fabric napkins smells old.  Food was delivered to us with no utensils.  

The eggrolls were ok like how they're supposed to be. 

Was very disappointed.  I saw the ad on the magazine and wanted to try this place but probably will not come back.

I've had Vietnamese at a handful of places in the valley and most places felt a little sketchy, the meat a little rubbery. However, this strip mall place is a step up from the average local Pho joint. The Crazy Noodle and Pho are both winners. The Vietnamese iced coffee is fantastic. Service is always great, prices are very reasonable.

Alright! This is my very first review and it's negative for the simple fact that I just had the worst experience at a Pho restaurant. 

I called in a to-go order at this place, that included Pho and spring rolls, and the host on the line stated my food would be ready in 10-15 min, thinking that is pretty long in my head but I did order crispy spring rolls with lettuce and mint leaves, so i say "sounds good." I get there 15 min after I placed my order and tell the host I was there to pick up and he gave me a deer in headlights look and said "we are running behind do you still want your order?" Not thinking he might have not placed my order when I called in (which is exactly what happened) I said "yes." It's raining out and I love Pho when it's raining! I actually waited another 20 min before my food came out while 2 other patrons came in and received their pick up orders. I said something to the host about it taking soo long 10 min in to the wait and again the deer in headlights glare came back and he said "sorry we're just so busy."
I would be OK with this if he would have told me on the phone that it would take 35 min to make Pho even though it's just broth and noodles!! I will never go back to this place, I will stick to my Saigon Pho on Alma School in between Warner and Ray in Chandler to fulfill my Pho needs!

PHO YOU PHOCKERS AT PHO DA LAT!!!!
Pho Tai - Easy rare Pho(Eye-round steak beef) Meat wasn't too rare, got cooked in the hot soup. Excellent food choices, quick and very attentive service.

They were just fine. Not that great and not that bad. The interior design was more likely a cafe which is actually very good. Only thing that bothers me is the price. The price on their menu is different from what you actually paying. My special pho appeared $10.95 on the menu but end it up with $11.95. Same thing happened to my roommate's rice plate. This is absolutely not cool, because on their Togo menu, the price get fixed. But anyway, I don't think I will go again or recommend to any one around me.
I love this place. It is right by both my office and home and I frequent it often. I get the Grilled Shrimp Bun. SO GOOD! It is quick, fresh and great price.
The chicken Pho here is amazing!! Great service and perfect for a lunch hour during work. I come here about every 2 weeks. Never a disappointment!

GREAT SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!! 
Every waiter or waitress I have had have been super helpful.
They always make sure that everyone likes their dish and if they don't, they offer to bring you a different dish... but I have never tried something I didn't like. I love their beef rolls and soups, their happy hour specials are a super great deal, and they have boba and thai tea. 
I haven't been to Vietnam and have no Vietnamese friends so I don't know how authentic the food is... but what I do know is that it always taste good. Also, their portions are the right size, big enough to get full but not to big that I feel like I'm going to explode if I finish my dish.
Finally, the interior decoration is very clean and contemporary. Also, they have a water feature by the entrance that creates a peaceful environment as you come in. 
I love this restaurant... is great!!!!!!!!

While in Tempe with the family and the mother in law, we stopped in for some Pho for lunch
We all had the Pho, My mother-in law who is Vietnamese, said the pho reminded her of Pho back home. Nuff said pho for lunch was great.  Service was great, though it was lunch time and we were 4 of the 8 in their at that time.  Really enjoyed the fried spring roll and the pineapple ice tea too.

I popped in spontaneously for a quick takeout lunch, but I was so happy with the Bun with spring rolls, I wanted to write a review.  It was fresh, delicious, minty, crisp, and refreshing -- and HUGE (I'll probably eat the rest for dinner, and maybe have leftovers even then).  And cheap!  $6.55 including tax for something I would have cheerfully paid $10 for.

The service was quick, kind, gracious.  I didn't realize that they prefer you pay cash under $15, but it was no problem that I only had a card.  The decor is nifty and modern.

I'll definitely be coming back for dinner and hopefully several more lunches in the future!  Hooray tasty Vietnamese in my very own neighborhood!

Well... what can I say?

The prices is expensive compared to other locations and I'm not sure what happened, but when my pho came out it tasted like it was burnt.

I'm giving this 3 stars because only good thing g was the mussels.

Awesome food, awesome service! The Easy Rare Pho was very good. 
Our server was super friendly and brought our food quickly. 
Try the Thai Iced Coffee... It's so decadent!
Here right now, sat down for 15 min without service. Workers too busy talking in the back. Seem to happen all the time. Mangers need to step up. The food is good but waitress and waiters suck.

The only place in town that offers Cá Nng Da Giòn (crispy grilled fish). The seasonsing is not as good as the one I had in Little Saigon, but it is still decent for a fun family dinner.
I also their Pho very good. The broth has a deep flavoring from beef bone. I cleaned my bowl without a drop left.

I work nearby here, decided to stroll in for a solo lunch. I've had my share of pho, but I have a phobia of orderng things that are difficult to eat. I apologize that was corny. Get used to it.

Anyway, the atmosphere and food are why I keep coming back. Nice and relaxing, sounds of running water abound, and attentive service. 

Only tried a few things here, but the pork vermicelli duo is outstanding. Fresh, feel good food that leaves you feeling rejuvenated, not bloated. Great for when you need to actually get some work done in the afternoon. Also try the iced tea with whipped cream, SUPER delish. Addictive! 

I will need to try their happy hour which seems solid also.

This place has a lot of bad reviews so I thought I'd come on here and say something nice. Pho was delicious, service was quick, and I will return. The only negative was the .45 charge to use my debit card (especially when my bank, Chase, is in the same parking lot). I've had plenty of pho before but this kind really struck my fancy. I hope people continue to go here because it's right next door to where I live and I would like to see them stay in business.

Went with a group of 7 of us, spur of the moment craving for Pho. Turned out to be a disappointing visit. The service was less than tolerable. The waitress was slow, doesn't know her menu, and a bit argumentative, had to ask for drink refills all night. When our food came out, which actually did not take long, we were disappointed at the skimpy vegetable servings for our Pho, the lack of sauce/gravy for the crispy egg noodle dish, and a complete misunderstanding of one of the orders. Not enough veggies, no problem, we just asked for an extra vegetable plate for the Pho to split between three of us, but it took them 3 trips back to our table to remember to bring it to us after 2 reminders. Then when we asked for more sauce for the dry crispy noodles, the kitchen came back and said they are unable to make more without making a whole other batch and essentially charging us another plate... As for the misunderstood order... My friend just asked for their chicken rice plate except he wanted to substitute the chicken with shrimp since shrimp rice plate was not an option on the menu, waitress said yes they can do that but will have to charge him extra which he was fine with. What my friend ended up with was a simple sauteed shrimp served over plain white rice in their smallest white rice bowl, nothing like what is shown in the pictures of their rice "plate." After several run arounds and back and forth with the kitchen about the rice plate we thought they finally understood so they took his dish back to the kitchen and what came back was merely the same thing now served back to him on a white plate... To top off the ridiculous evening we were told we had to be charged a fee for using our credit cards! To be fair, the Special Pho was good but nothing spectacular, definitely not worth enduring the poor customer service when there are other Pho restaurants serving better food and with service that exceeds Pho Dalat's by 100%

I came here a few times with friends and was excited to take my husband to eat here for lunch until he got FOOD POISONING! TMI we could not even make it back home before pulling over. I will be reporting this case of food poising to the Maricopa County Environmental Services Department
Great food and great location for a 15 person lunch.

I love coming for the Pho!  This place is right around the corner from my office and when I need an escape from the phone I figure this is the place to go.  I usually go between the shrimp fried rice and the chicken Pho.  Always start with the crispy spring rolls, they are awesome.  I've been here a bunch of times and should probably try something else, but this is the thing I love the most.  Keep serving it and a word to the wise, try a little Sriracha in the bowl with the lime.  Its awesome.
Amazing pho and fast service. They could update the music a bit though. The Bee Gee' s
We love coming here for authentic Vietnamese foods. The menu is great, the service is fantastic, and the staff is friendly. The pho is excellent!

This is my first time here. I don't know about other dishes but the rice plate I had was pretty good. The fish sauce mix was perfect, the grilled pork chop was cooked to perfection, the over easy egg was done well. I tried the pho and it was a typical tasting pho, nothing to rave about. I guess comparing this place to Pho Thuan Kieu at Mekong Plaza, for the prize and the amount of side dishes that they give you here, Pho Thuan Kieu gives you more for your dollar. I think I would stop by here if I was ever in the Ahwatukee area to try other dishes. 

Ambience: A
Service: A
Price: B
Food: A

STAY AWAY!!! This place is TRASH. First off the pho was about room temperature. The broth tasted gross, like it had been sitting out or something, and the meatballs were made of rubber. 

I took a few bites, and decided to send back the bowl of inedible meat and noodles. I asked that the manager please remove the item from our bill since I was not satisfied with the food. The manager said he would give me another bowl, but I would have to pay for it. I didn't want anymore of there disgusting food, and the manager would not take it off the bill, so I paid, and left. 

I will never return, and I would not recommend this place to anyone. If you're reading this, please save yourself the frustration, and go somewhere else

This restaurant is located close to my husband's office so we've met there for lunch a few times and actually wish that it was closer to where we live as we would certainly frequent this place.  We had the veggie spring rolls, which are very fresh and delicious.  Our favorite is also the vegetarian Pho which has broccoli, mushrooms, baby corn, and other veggies in addition to a generous portion of rice noodles and is served with the usual plate of bean sprouts, thai basil, cilantro, jalapenos, and lime.  We typically add tofu as well and all of the ingredients are very fresh and high quality.  Another nice aspect is that they offer both the traditional beef broth and a vegetable broth.  We've found the beef broth to be a bit more flavorful, but for those adhering to a vegan diet, the vegetable broth would still provide a flavorful option.

Another plus is that this restaurant also serves alcohol and offers a daily happy hour, so it would also make a nice dinner spot as the atmosphere is more tasteful than many Vietnamese restaurants.  If you're a fan of Pho, this is a place you'll want to check out.

I've been coming here for a while now and every time I dine here I try something new. Today I tried the roasted quail, it was exquisite. Never been let down here, the pho is amazing, the ox tail sauté is even better. Even the mussels appetizer is great. Definitely a must to try this place. Make sure you get the Thai tea with boba for your drink! Only thing that could be worked on is the service, not that it was bad but they didn't stop by our table to check on us that often.
This place is bomb. The best pho I've had in Phx and reasonably priced. Food comes out hot and they're quick. I will def be back again. Highly recommend

I have tried several things here in the past few weeks and they have all been very good.  I don't eat a whole lot of Vietnamese food, but this place is real close to my neighborhood so that is always a plus.  They have made the restaurant bigger so there is plenty of seating although they due tend to be busy around lunch time.  The last few times they weren't breaking any records for speed even though my waitress was very nice.  I'm not sure this would be the best place if you are in a hurry. I appreciate the vegetarian options they have on the menu.  I thought the Vegetarian Pho was very good.  I haven't had many versions to compare it too, but it was much much better than the vegetarian versions I have had at the noodle shop downtown. The Tofu Vermicelli is really great.  it;s a cross between a hot noodle dish and a salad.  Which sounds kind of odd, but it's very good. They also have a pretty efficient take out so calling in and picking up isn't a problem.

Try:

- Vegetarian Pho.
- Tofu Vermicelli

Simply the best rice and soup I have had in a long time. I had the combo rice. I usually NEVER order it because as much as I love it. It's always greasy. Not here. Also had the shrimp and port wonton soup. Just the amount of ingredients I like. I'll be back soon.

I am not giving this place more than 3 stars for 2 reasons ... First reason was their prices are on a expensive side and second for their services.  There's really no service whatsoever, I really don't understand that.  Once they brought my drink, water, and took my order, I don't see them again until they deliver my food.  And I don't see the server again when I'm done eating and receives my check.  The Pho tasted good, but the soup wasn't hot at all and has no flavor in it.

And once my check came, it listed how much to tip, 15%, 18%, and 20%.  And seriously, you don't provide any service at all, why should I follow your suggested tipping chart?  I will be driving to somewhere else for decent bowl of Pho, even if it's a long drive.

I went there a couple times first I was told that the whole place was closed for a private party. Second time I went they told me their chef/cook was gone for a month said they were serving soups only.  What restaurant has no cook really. Place isn't good
I got the bún bò hu, and it was one of the best I've had. The soup was flavorful and had the right level of spice. Service was great.

The food and service has taken a nose dive in the last three trips there. I ordered Brisket Pho and got serloin or something and when I asked for a different dish since I was not happy with that one the waitress argued with me that it was brisket. I didnt need the arguement, I have had the brisket Pho at least ten times it was different. I think I will just go somewhere else now.

The price was "ok" and a bit high but I have to say that their food portions were large. I got pho with everything in it and as a vietnamese person who eats pho regularly, this was not all that great. There was hardly meat, just mostly ramen and soup. The flavor wasn't entirely there, at least not what I am use to. Save your money and head over to Saigon for some good pho for the right price on Alma school.

What an excellent find. Was dropping off a friend close by and saw this place for a quick lunch. Glad I did. Pho was excellent. No need for hoisin or any other addition. Highly flavorful and recommended.

The food is DELICIOUS!

The atmosphere and service is OK.  Kind of dirty and a big turnover of employees. 

I keep going back for the food though.  The crispy spring rolls, pho and yellow chicken curry are delicious!

Let me start off by saying that our server was friendly, friendlier than most I have had a Vietnamese restaurants. However after she took our order we did not see her again until it was time to pay the bill. There were about 6 or 7 other tables in the restaurant and other servers walked by us constantly and ignored the fact we had been done and sitting there for 15 minutes. 

Now onto the food, I got the easy rare Pho, when the Pho came out  I did not smell the usual aroma of onion, ginger and other spices that make Pho the best soup ever.  Instead I smelled salt. This was troubling. After tasting the broth I immediately knew what I was smelling and now tasting, beef bouillon. There was a very subtle flavor almost like watered down  Pho. The taste and flavor of the bouillon lingered on my tongue and left and and odd feeling in my mouth. This was probably the saddest excuse for Pho I have ever had. Real Pho requires a missive amount of bones and spices to create the broth that soothes the soul. Now onto my husband, order the charbroiled pork Bun, his vegetables were mushy the pork was not anywhere on par with other places we've been. Again watered down flavor. 

To top all of this off this place is more expensive that other Vietnamese restaurants we frequent. Save your money, visit another Vietnamese restaurants we have in the area, there are much, much, much better ones than this place.

My go to place for good pho. The beef rolls and the easy rare pho are my favorites. The only problem I've ever had is sometimes the soup is not hot enough to cook the meat completely-but that is a personal preference.

I have to say, Pho Da Lat always has the most beautiful lettuce leaves

Ordered the Vietnamese Crepe.  At $5.95 regular menu price it's a nice light "dare I say healthy" meal.  As the picture shows, it comes with a stack of said beautiful lettuce leaves, sprigs of mint, cucumber wedges, and a bowl of fish sauce.  The crepe itself is minimally filled with a few shrimp, a few slices of meat, spinach, scallions, and bean sprouts.  By itself it's not exactly a flavor rush, so wrap some up in the lettuce and mint, and dip it into the fish sauce.  Spice it up with The Rooster if you need to.
Delicious and authentic if you ask me. Been to vn and tasted pho from different region and the soup here reminds me of the street food pho.

I have had Vietnamese may times, and this place is easily one of the best. Pho is a bit overrated for my taste (plus soup is not something I go out for), so I wanted to try something with noodles.

I'm gluten-free so I can't eat anything wheat-based, but I can have rice, potatoes, and corn. Their rice vermicelli noodles are so good. I got the #32 which is a combo of a spring roll, marinated pork, and shrimp on a bed of room-temperature noodles (sounds weird, tastes amazing) on another bed of shredded cucumber, lettuce, mint, and basil. It comes with aside of what I believe is a fish sauce, but does not taste like fish. It's more of a sweet and savory sauce. I really liked this place, and cannot wait to go back.

Favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Tempe ! Having to stay in Tempe for a few months for work I seriously tried almost every restaurant close by to my hotel. This place was always consistent in flavor and service. Love their pho dac biet. And eggs rolls! Comparing it to the other restaurants in the area this one will make your tummy and wallet happier!

I'm feeling a little generous with this review. The food deserves 3 stars overall, but the pepper tofu is so out of this world delicious that I'm willing to bump them up to 4. As a vegetarian in Phoenix, I'm always starved for entree options, and I wish there were more dishes like this. I got this dish to go while I waited for my car to be serviced nearby, and a couple employees walked by to tell me how good my lunch smelled. I asked for it extra spicy, and the extra jalapenos added just enough heat.

I came back again with my husband to try some of their veggie pho, and I was disappointed. It was good but nothing special. My husband felt the same way about his beefy pho. We shared a plate of spring rolls, and they were so bland. Even the peanut dipping sauce had very little flavor.

We would still come back to try other dishes here. A big lure was the large wine list where all bottles are $20. The great $20 price tag puts many of the bottles right a retail cost which is awesome when you're dining out. Sign me up for some La Crema.

I went vegan about 10 months ago and was a little depressed about not being able to eat pho anymore, but then I discovered Pho Da Lat and their veggies pho made with veggie broth.  It is so amazing, and one of the best deals around.  $5.99 lunch special for a huge bowl of soup with tons of veggies!  And the broth is really, really tasty.  I am now addicted to this place and I go three times a week.  My family loves it too and my 11-year-old daughter loves the pho tai.  The servers are all super cool, especially Annie.  I have eaten here about 25 times and I have never had a bad experience or anything short of excellent service and great food.  I like when you order the veggies pho and they always ask whether or not you want the veggie broth - that is always a good feeling when you don't eat meat or dairy.  They have other vegan dishes as well but I have yet to try them because the veggies pho is so darn good (#16 on the lunch menu).  Definitely a good place for non-vegans too.  I wish they had vegetarian crispy egg rolls, but that is the only negative thing I can think of.  Every time I go in here it is busier and busier because the word is getting around.  My wife likes the wine selection - $6 for a glass.  The interior is really nice and pleasant - good place for a date.

Seriously, eat here.  You won't be sorry.  Man, I want to go there right now but it's only 7:30am.  Shoot.

Sorry Pho Da Lat .. I'm from California where the PHO is original.  Your PHO's broth is sweet and not sure why.  I ate the PHO Deluxe $8.50 (the most expensive pho i ever purchased).  However, I saw other people eating rice dishes which I'll def go back to try.  It's hard to find good asian food in AZ.  Note: If you plan on using CC than make sure you purchase more than $15 otherwise you will be charge .45 cents to process your CC.
I always heard about pho but never tried it. I'm so happy to have found this place! Delicious! I get the chicken pho:)

I go here for lunch with friends a few times a month.  Had various types of the Pho, all delicious.  The food quality is consistently good.  Vietnamese iced coffee is very good.  I'll continue going back for a long time.
I've been there 3'times for lunch and each meal was delicious. This place is the real deal for Vietnamese food. The Pho portions are huge too.

Heres a hint

The next time a customer comes in and there is a mixup on an order...dont ask the customer "can you pay..." when he has a credit card and cash in his hand.  It is very disrespectful no matter how good your food may be.  I dont care if you were givng away gold bricks out of that funboy establishment i wouldnt drive by there ever again.....

I LOVE Vietnamese food... I am always trying new ones in every part of the valley so naturally I had to give this one a review.

Service: They can't tell you what's in the dishes... Typical to vietnamese/pho restaurants, service isn't 5-star. When I asked what was in the "house sauce" they told me that they didn't know and that none of the servers knew because they weren't the ones in the kitchen making it.... OK.

Food: Really good! A lot of different options. I had the #11 pho with brisket and flank steak but added rare steak. Lots of meat so that's always good. I didn't even try the broth before adding a bunch of basil, jalapeños, sriracha and chili paste so I can't comment on that. 

Drink: Their wine list is pretty great for a pho place. They also have great prices on the bottles so that's always a plus! 

I probably would eat here again if I was in the area but definitely not a place I'd go out of my way to eat at. They're also open much later than most pho so that's another reason to return.

My partner and I were looking for a place to get Pho that would be open until 10pm on a Friday, and found this gem!  Wonderful atmosphere - koi fish, mini waterfall, wonderfully decorated. Perfect for a date night on a budget. 

My partner had some kind of Pho with meat (beef, I think), and I had the veggie Pho. Our waitress was thoughtful enough to ask if I wanted beef or vegetable broth. 

We both received huge bowls of Pho with plenty of the condiments - mint leaf, jalapeno, lime, and bean sprouts. Our food came quickly and was piping hot. The vegetables were perfectly done - still fresh and with a crunch, but cooked through. My partner loved hers, as well (and she's one of the pickiest eaters I know when it comes to eating out!)

We walked out of there after getting two bowls of Pho, a diet Coke, and a Thai Tea and only spent $20+tip. Our waitress didn't bother us every two seconds, but was very attentive when we asked her for something - drink refill, to go box - which is how I wish all waitstaff were! We walked out of there 2 minutes until closing time, but never felt rushed. We'll definitely be stopping by again!

I was craving some Pho and didn't have much time on my lunch break so I called Pho Da Lat since it was the closest.  I called ahead and ordered the #11.  
5-10 minutes they said, which was great!  
Prices were about .50-1.00 higher than most of the Pho places I've been to, but that's not bad.
The broth was delicious, they were a little skimpy on the beef, but I could deal with that.  
The problem and the reason for the lower rating was the fact that the host who brought my $7.00 pho to me asked if I needed change after giving him $10.00, Umm, scuse me?
I contemplated about posting this as I don't want to sound petty, but....
I always tip for to-go orders at sit-down restaurants, at the very least 10%, and round up.
But I was shocked this guy presumed I was going to tip 30+% on one item?? 
A little pretentious I thought.  How bout bringing my change first and let me decide if I am tipping? (which I was going to, but he seemed to be petty as well taking his sweet time bringing my change to me).  Sorry, but service goes right along with the food when it comes to rating,  This would have been a solid 4-star.
Tried the chicken pho and fresh garden roll. The soup base is delicious! Worth a try if you are craving for Vietnamese food like Pho. :)

They are busy even on late Monday evening. We came in and we're seated promptly. The pork spring rolls were freshly prepared and were great. It was all downhill from there. The pho beef broth lacked any significant flavor and appeared to be watered down perhaps because it was getting late and they were running low, but either way, it was not good at all. Additionally, they use instant jasmine tea which should be an automatic no-no for any Asian style restaurant or any other restaurants for that matter. I chose this place based on the reviews, and was disappointed as a result. It's hard to give a restaurant another chance when flaws such as I've described exist.
Good pho! Pretty good service. I guess good atmosphere if your in to that type of thing.

Terrible restaurant! Ignored by wait staff for an inordinate amount of time until finally someone noticed we hadn't even been given menus, another wait to give our order, then after about 30 minutes more of being ignored as well as not being served we approached staff requesting to speak with a manager. Response: no manager here! We walked out, after having wasted an hour for nothing! AVOID THIS AWFUL PLACE,

I am not going to say much about this place because the only thing I really liked about it were the light fixtures.

I tried the Crystal Chicken. Bland.

I tried the Crispy Sring rolls. Overcooked.

The only thing that was yummy was the #51.. and I have no idea what it was called but my friend got it and I tried it and it was pretty alright.

They have a koi pond inside right when you walk in, but I was disturbed at the size of the fish in that little pool.. Definitely not enough room, and I'm thinking this might be a violation, and i'm looking into it. I may eat fish, but I don't believe the living ones should be confined like that.. I certainly don't like elevators, do you?

We have been dining at this restaurant for several years. It's been one of our favorite go-to spots for years. 

Today is no different. The staff all appear to be new. Dante was our server and he was very attentive. Our orders came out perfect - even with my special requests / modifications!

We went here for dinner the other night and I had the tofu and pepper dish and my friend had the shrimp and pepper dish.  Unfortunately the order was wrong and there was shrimp cooked along with my tofu dish. If I was allergic to shrimp I would probably be dead.  I gave my shrimp to my friend and enjoyed the rest of my meal. 

Besides the slight mix up with our orders the server was very friendly and attentive. The restaurant was also very clean. I will most likely be coming back here again.

I've had pho all over the valley and consider myself somewhat of an enthusiast. Pho Da Lat is not the best that I've ever had but it was definitely within the top 3. Restaurant is clean, service is super friendly and quick (I appreciated this because I only had 45 minutes for my lunch break), they have a great beer/wine selection. Overall, it was a great experience and I highly recommend paying them a visit if you haven't already.

I wish I could put a 4.5 star. Cause a whole star is too harsh. However it doesn't deserve 5 stars... Yet.

Pho was good. Very flavorful and filling. Bit pricey but good and filling. Takes some time to refill water. But place was clean and food was good.

I tried pho for the first time a few months ago at a different restaurant and really liked it, so when I found Pho Da Lat, I was excited to have another big bowl of that delicious soup. I visited  here late on a Friday evening and the restaurant was not busy so I was seated fast. I liked the interior decorations and the little pond they have at the entrance. I ordered spring roles and pho and they were both good. It was not a fabulous dinner but it was fairly close to what I expected.
Excellent lunch, very attentive staff,  very fresh and good food!  Ready to come back again soon!

Convenient since we live in Tempe and pretty good Vietnamese food.
They also have Pho with vegetarian based soup which is unusual because almost always it is a beef broth.
Great pho at a great price! The fresh spring rolls are the best in town. The ultimate hang over cure ;)
Very delicious Pho and spring rolls the service was very quick and great prices my total was $12.36 for both!!

Great service and the BEST iced coffee I've ever had... That said DO NOT... I repeat do not have more than one.  We are both seasoned coffee drinkers and we were kept up till 2:00 am 4 hrs past bed time.
I love the Bun here!

This restaurant remains a true 5 starer! After my initial review I have returned at least 15 times. And I plan on returning many, many more. 

The food quality remains fresh and consistent. The service is always prompt and friendly. The value is unquestionable. 

Definitely try this place!
Uhhhhh...Yum!! And, the service is AMAZING!!! Apparently they just doubled in size, and I can see why!! This place is great. Even though it's a little out of the way for us, we WILL be back!!!!!!
Best Mussels.  Best Lemonade.  Quiet, Relaxing.  Good.  Would Highly Recommend.

This is a great place for pho and offers a large variety of different choices. 

I've come to rate other pho's against the pho here.  They don't skip out on the spices and know how to make some of the most flavorful broth around. Meat is always fresh.

My daughter and I usually get the combo fried rice and crazy noodles. It is a lot of food for two but means lunch leftovers the next day. The combo fried rice is a perfect as a leftover.  Try it, you'll like it.

I've dined in and done take out.  I prefer dining in as the ambience is so nice but if you get it to go, they take care to package it properly.

The decor is very nice, open and most important, clean.  Check out the bathrooms, they are spotless.  Service is always friendly and prompt.

Great value, great food. Go now, thank me later.
Best Pho ever! Highly recommend coconut water! The whole environment great authentic Phooo! My new favorite

One of the okay Pho I had coming from a Vietnamese I'm very picky, the service not so great me and my boyfriend waited to be seated but no one came out so we seat ourself but then got bitch at for doing that, maybe have a hostess if you wanted to seat people. OVER PRICED FOR PHO GO SOME WHERE ELSE WHY WOULD YOU PAY FOR OVER PRICED FOOD AND BAD SERVICE

I came in here prior to getting my hair done at the salon next door.  I only got a to-go order of Vietnamese Iced Coffee but I enjoyed the decor and atmosphere of the restaurant.  The servers were all attentive to myself and to the other guests as I people watched and waited for my coffee.  I definitely plan on returning here with my boyfriend so that we can try out the foods!

This is the only place I go for Pho. Best in town. Awesome service, the sweet gentleman that was our waiter carded me. they do their best to make sure we are happy and taken care of. Everything we requested that brought it in a timely manner. I'm going to tell everyone about this place
Fake Americanized Vietnamese food.  Small portions and more like Chinese food than Vietnamese food.  Will never eat here again. It's nasty or gross.

This is the worst service I have ever experienced. The workers all sit on a crate next to the backroom,using their phones while you wait for any kind of service. Whenever I would ask for water or anything else the server walks away before I can finish my sentence. Not even any sort of acknowledgement.

I know I sound like a priss but I've worked many years in customer service so I'm very polite when I go to restaurants or any public place. But I have never experienced this level of rudeness and horrible service on multiple occasions, not just once. 

The food is decent, but the Pho only contains a baby's bite worth of noodles.

The food was GREAT!  A large menu with a lot of options, lots of noodle/soup combinations, Vermicelli/meat and Rice/meat dishes.  Very reasonably priced too- with appetizers our meal came to $20 (we didn't get drinks though)! appetizers start at $2.99, entree's range from $6.95 up to $12.95.

I had the Beef with Lemon-grass Chili sauce over jasmine rice and LOVED it, it was very flavorful.  This restaurant offers "choose your own spice level 1-5".  I ordered a 3 and there certainly was a kick to it, I like spice though and probably could have done a 4.

The atmosphere was nice and clean, good earthy colors of green and brown helped add to the clean and simple feel.  The bathrooms were the nicest and cleanest I have seen in a restaurant in YEARS.  

The only downside to the experience was the service.  The wait staff were polite and kind just dreadfully slow!  After finishing our meal we waited about 10min for someone to come check on us and offer us our check- no one came.  I had to flag down the hostess who brought us our check.  Placing our order was a lengthy process as well.  After we placed our appetizer order it seemed forever before they came back for our dinner order.
Pho was good and the service as well.   Was not overly impressed, but will try again.

Very spacious inside. The first time I went it took a while for the staff to acknowledge I was waiting to be seated. The menu options for vegans are great. Awesome pho and spring rolls. However, the first time I ordered the spring rolls without mint and I was definitely served rolls with mint. Decent pho spot super close to my house. I'll likely be a regular.

TLDR: Solid Pho price with average prices. It's a bit cleaner than your average vietnamese restaurant.

I've been eating A LOT of pho lately and this is one of the many places I've been to. I only eat seafood so my order is usually pretty standard. The pho itself usually doesn't have too much variation so I look at other things about the restaurant.

The price was just average compared to most pho places, nothing exceptionally cheap, but it stood out he place is a lot cleaner than most other Vietnamese places. The service was also great, they were very friendly and prompt about everything. I wanted an item that wasn't on the menu but didn't bother asking because I didn't think they would bother making a special order of spring rolls for me. My BF asked anyways and they happily accommodated.

Mussels didn't live up to description. Food was plain even though I ordered my dishes spicy. Totally Americanized, which means it's more bland. Waitress was pleasant & the atmosphere was nice. But for flavor it totally failed.
Best bun Bo hue I have had in the valley. Beyond that I can't say. I have gone for lunch 3 times, and the service was good. No issues.

Great, fresh food,...very healthy!!  Portions are huge and the Pho is great too.  Excellent prices.  Service is super friendly, attentive...feels like family. Atmosphere is calming, open, clean and comfortable. It's surprising that such an excellent place is in such a slow corner strip mall, but very nice.  I wish I could give another 1/2 star,.....only took a half off because the flavor is a little bland, but that may be all Vietnamese food,....this food tastes very fresh and authentic!!

Definitely the best Vietnamese food I've had of the 4 places I've been!!

Highly recommend trying it, you won't be sorry.
Such a yummy place and quick service. Inside also looks very clean. I recommend this place to anyone in the area craving Vietnamese food.

This place is really nice.  It is clean, wide open and modern inside.  The Pho is pretty darn good.  Not the best in the area, but good.  The price is right especially for lunch.  Their spring rolls are always fresh and they will even sell a half order (one roll) which is nice if you go by yourself.  Have not tried the rest of the menu, but it looks like it would be worth a shot.

Did NOT enjoy the service here today. And this was my second time. 

Came in and the host or waitress just stood there staring at me and my friend. She didn't say one word to us. I had to tell her table for 2 please. There was NO greet from her. She sat us down and no menus were given to us from her at all. 

We sat down and no one came over to check on us. We had to wave our hands up to get someone's attention. 

Horrible horrible services but the food is good.
Great food. Great price! Pho Dalat is the quintesential Pho restaurant.

My favorite Pho place. It's within 1 mile and so delicious. Can't get enough of the mussels and beef rolls as well as the easy rare pho. I'm sure the rest of their food is just as awesome but can't steer my way from these favorites yet.
Typical vietnamese service, good service for the white people, and careless for other customer.  Food was ok, price is alright.  overall, the service brings their score down
Always good food !, PHO DA LAT is he best in Phx , Veggie broth , Veggie Pho with steamed tofu is awesome , and don't forget to order the quail appetizer :) ..
Great Pho. We come here once a week. I have tried the veggie spring rolls, and the garlic chicken, all of which were great!

Best place if your under the weather and needing some hot soup with Siracha! Pretty decent spring rolls and tried the mussels which were too rich for me.  All in all its our pho go to on this side of town.

It's now called Pho Dalat instead of Pho Sapa...
I had the Lemon Grass Chicken and it is by far the best I have ever tasted.  The spice level is somwhat weird, it's 1 through 5 and a 9...I get the 9 and it is still full of flavor and doesn't taste like all chilli sauce.

The decor is relaxing, unlike typical mom and pop places where I feel a bit uneasy, the selection is great you can tell them to cook it anyway you like, with beef or veggie etc., the price is resonable. 

The service is a bit slow, but I think that is the industy standard as far as asian cuisine goes.

This was my first vietnamese experience, and WOW!

I am extremely allergic to peanuts, and was worried about my allergy impeding on my culinary excursion.

However, the staff at Pho Sapa was more than accomodating, and once I showed that I knew nothing of Vietnamese cuisine, they walked me through the menu and gave me many suggestions.

For my boyfriend and I we ordered
-  Pho Special
- Lemongrass Chili Chicken
- Spring Rolls

It was all sooooooooo good.  We requested spicy level 4 (out of 5), and I actually probably could have handled the 5.

We also had the Vietnamese iced coffee, and it was so good it puts Starbucks to shame.

We ordered all the food to go, and the staff even helped carry the food out to our car with us!

Excellent experience, food, and service, we will be returning A LOT :)

The food are not bad at all, it just that they not give enough meat. And when I order to go the Dalat Special Pho - they missing several of beef items on it that supposedly on it. Expect slow service during lunch hours. Other than that it's pretty good food with less meat.

What a pleasant surprise!  The first time I visited this place was about two years ago and my wife and I were very disappointed. I went there recently and discovered they had expanded and the pho tasted great!  Needless to say, I told my wife I had found a new place and brought her back and she agrees. I love that it is down the street from where I work. Now when I have a taste for pho, this is where I'll go.

I love the decor.  Easily in the top 2 for decor of the pho places I've visited.  Massive serving of pho.  

However, I've had better pho in other places.  The broth was very light and not too salty but it was missing something (I think someone else said this) and I will agree with the other poster about their rice dishes; that looked pretty good.  A friend had the veggie pho and that looked pretty delish, actually; and healthy.

Yes.  Bring cash.

Vegetarian Pho with Veggie Broth? YES PLEASE!! When you walk into the restaurant, it is a little dark. However, the pho was very flavorful! I like to add extra limes in my soup for some extra sourness. The service was great as well. When I ordered my Vegetarian Pho, the waiter immediately asked me if I wanted Veggie Broth. The only downside was that they charge $0.45 for a credit card charge of under $15. If you are going to go by yourself, make sure to take cash unless you are planning on buying two meals.

Over all the food was good. I had a room temperature rice dish with beef and a crispy roll. I am not normally a fan of fish sauce but theirs was good. I did not add the whole dish, I feel like it would have been too much. I did however add some sauce for additional flavor.

I also loved their iced coffee!

Finally! A vegetarian - friendly pho broth. I actually tried pho for my first time a few months ago even though we have been going to Vietnamese restaurants forever. I just can't enjoy pho because I'm a vegetarian but the veggie broth is amazing. They have so many delicious, fresh veggies in the soup and I always have to get it to go. Love it here! I crave their broth all the time!!

My standby place for a good healthy lunch.  Excellent pho, good bun, and the 2 daily chicken specials (summer grilled chicken and salt/pepper chicken w/rice) are fantastic.   Staff is always courteous though sometimes a little overwhelmed by the lunch crowd - especially on Fridays.

We came to town for Superbowl "festivities" and since it was a rainy and  cold night, what better than having pho for dinner. We had to order it to-go because it was almost closing time. The serving size is good and so are their prices.

The flavor is VERY good, we had the pho with tendon and brisket, and brisket and rare steak. Overall is is really good food and I would recommend it. The only asterisk would be that the pho is a bit too greasy in my opinion compared to other ones we've had in other places (El Paso, Denver, Houston, Hanoi, Saigon). But as I said, the the flavor, pricing and serving size really make up for everything. Thumbs up!

Expensive!! Small portions, flavorless, poor presentation... Just some words off the top of my head. AND!!! They charged me an EXTRA FEE for using my debit card! There are plenty of other Pho places in the valley that are waaay better than this place.

I love Vietnamese food, so I just had to try this place. 

I was pleased with this restaurant. They had great food and offered lots of variety in the menu, including rice dishes, pho, buns, and more. I never tried quail but it was surprisingly good (it tastes like a saltier/chewier/bonier version of chicken if you're curious). The sauce on top of the quail topped off the appetizer - I would recommend it. We had another appetizer - the tofu spring rolls. It tasted very healthy and clean, and I liked the peanut sauce that came with it. 

I ordered the chicken "bun" noodles, which had rice noodles, lettuce, chicken smothered in sauce and a side of fish sauce. My friend got the vegetarian pho, which she enjoyed. 

The server checked in pretty often and were very polite and helpful with our order. While we were unfamiliar with some of the menu items (like the quail), she provided us a detailed explanation of what the appetizer would entail. I'm glad that she did, because it convinced us to get the order. Yum yum!

I went to dinner on a Thursday evening and there were quite a large amount of people in there - Pho Da Lat has good business which shows that customers regularly go to this restaurant.

Pho is pricey and has very little flavor. The veggies were stale and few. I had the pho special with everything in it. It was disappointing. I had been here a few years back and didn't like it but wanted to give them another shot today because I was craving some Vietnamese food. I'll stick with the good oil' Da Vang or Pho Thanh for some good pho at a reasonable price.

I work in the area and come here maybe once a month when I have a pho craving and need a place near work.  The decor is relaxing, and the music is pleasant.  I find service to be fast which is really important during lunch.

On one side, the prices are a little on the high side, and the pho is somewhat bland.  On the other side, a lot of my American coworkers won't go to a mom and pop pho house.  Pho Dalat is somewhere they would be okay with.

If you're on that side of town.. have a pho craving.. then Pho Dalat will definitely cure that.. but don't get expected to be wow'ed by the complex flavors of the broth

My FIRST Vietnamese Restaurant experience in Arizona !!

The place is very clean and welcoming. 

The waitress I had spoke perfect English and understood everything .

The food was above average but it could be that I am comparing it to a restaurant in Chicago. Lets just say I do like their food and I will return.

I took one star off because the staff was making too much noise fooling around while we were eating. After this is a serious restaurant?

This place is huge inside. It has a stage. Had the Crispy Spring  rolls best I ever had in my life.  Had pho soup with shrimp and steak. Good taste and a lot of soup. I like this place has one size they don't have a small or large bowl. Prices are super cheap. Will come back here again

This is a nice clean spacious place, they even have a stage area. I had to get the Pho combination #8 and it was decent, so it was avg.  Portion size was avg, but barely had any protein, which explains the price. They need to add a large bowl option. I'm willing to try other dishes, but won't be back for Pho. They also said there is a 45 cent surcharge for using a credit card, which no legit business should do. This place gets 4 stars, service and food gets a 3.5 for me.

I'm a fan. 

The Pho here is worth driving for. The Spring rolls are delicious. The mussels were... meh. They don't have a shake selection that you normally find at Vietnamese places, but their soups make up for it on a cold day. Mmm.
Come for HH, it'll allow you to eat more AND save money at the same time

The Pho had too much noodles and not enough meat. The price seemed a little high for such a simple soup. 

Service was prompt and the venue is very pretty, but I would not return.

Heard about this place from a friend and yelped it of course.  Loved it.  Tried the Spicy Beef  Vermicelli, Summer Rolls and my hubby had the Special Pho.  Everything was great, including the service!  The beef broth on the Pho was especially tasty.  We'll be back.

Honestly my go to place for Vietnamese food. I'd refer people to this place in a heartbeat. The staff is great and friendly. The have options for gluten free replacements which made it great to bring my girlfriend here for her first taste of Pho. Food is great and delicious.

Had lunch here the other day and the waitress was so bad I don't know if I will ever return!  Food was average and not compelling enough to draw me back in with such poor service. But, note is that the pho broth did not appear to from a jar!!!
Not the greatest or the cheapest but they are the closest to my house and only spot in Southwest Chandler/Tukee area. So when I need a quick a fix, it's at least convenient.

The Fresh spring rolls awesome , I highly suggest them! I really love the seafood pho so good !! The service has always been great everytime I've gone there . always hot and fresh ! This is the place I get my Pho Fix . So if you happen to be In south Tempe , stop in to the awesome spot !

This place is pretty Americanized for an "authentic" Vietnamese restaurant. 

The thai iced tea was served with whipped cream. Who does that? And the boba was hard, not chewey like it should be. 

We had to ask for fish sauce, red chili and chopsticks - all Vietnamese staples which should have already been on the table. I am leery of any "authentic" Asian restaurant where the patrons are only expected to eat with forks. 

My husband ordered the ginger clam dish. (I attached a photo) Unfortunately, it was all presentation and no substance. The dish was beautiful, but there were more shells than clams. My husband is a big man and five tiny clams just didn't fill him up.

As far as Vietnamese food goes, Khai Hoan still has my heart.

Ive been here more than a few. Ive read alot of reviews saying service is excellent haha either they had a little too much wine or ive been with all the bad waiters and waitresses. 
Food 4 stars and Service -1 stars. Come for the food everyone! But dont expect good service.

Clean, fast, great service. 

This is my go-to spot for lunch!
The restaurant is very clean, but the broth is diluted, overall it is an ok vietnameese place.

I've been trying different Pho places throughout the Chandler area. Pretty descent spot. Tried the soup. Broth was very flavorful. Bowl was a little small. Wish they had size options. Good food though. Will definitely eat here again.

Really Good Pho, Kind Of Skimpy Serving Size

To start this review off the broth is rather exceptional. The flavor is so good that by the time you're done with the broth you're wondering where the rest of your food is. 

There isn't a lot of meat and even the noodle portion could've been a little bit more. I like when places have the extra large bowl option because I'm a big guy and like to eat a lot.

I felt like the service was nominally all right, but when it came time to pay I had to keep waving my money around in order to get someone to come let me pay so I could go.

I feel like I want to give a 3 1/2 star rating on this place but in all fairness because the broth is so good I gave it a four star. If you're not a huge eater you will think the portion is perfect.

So the food was decent, the service was absolutely terrible and I was charged for a soda when all I got was carbonated water... I asked why and the poor waiter said that when they don't charge for it, the owner takes it out of their check.. Are you kidding me? Not like I needed 2 dollars, and not like it was a big deal but it was when the waiter told me about the owner. I will never be back and don't recommend. It looks like they are struggling anyways so good luck attempting to obtain clients with the way you practice  your business and treat your employees. If you are the owner, and you want to reach out to me and talk about it let me know. I'd love to give you a piece of my mind.

This place is one of the best places where I tried Vietnamese food. The waitress was energetic and very friendly.  I tried vegetarian pho and thai iced tea, Both were amazing.  The Vietnamese pho tasted really good and the quantity was huge. Its a lot for the money you pay and I am sure 1 person cannot finish the bowl.

My wife and I eat here as often as we can. Love the beef rolls. The service is always good. Unfortunately I can never remember the name of the dish I get. Usually one of the bowls with noodles, fish sauce, pork and crispy spring roll in it or some variation of that dish. We love it.

The food was really good, but service was slow. They have two servers and about 5 tables when I was there. I ordered a Pho noodle, before I got my check, my server never came to ask how's everything like other restaurant did.a little disappointed.
