One simple word for you.... BUN... This is my go to dish on a  hot summers day, my mouth is watering right now just thinking about the cool, crisp, deliciousness. Living in Tempe there are probably 5 Vietnamese restaurants within a 4 mile radius of my house, most of them are mediocre at best. So I decided to drive out of my normal Tempe hood and check this place out. I am the takeout queen... having an active 2 year old makes it hard for me to actually sit down in a restaurant and enjoy my meal, so I opt for takeout 99% of the time. I ordered the Bun with chicken, and a side of spring rolls. The customer service was awesome, the ladies were super nice. While waiting my son enjoyed watching the little koi pond they have. Back to the food.. It was very good! The bun was perfect temperature, the fish sauce was the perfect balance of salty and sweet, and when I asked for extra sauce they gave me a ton without flinching.  The spring roll were amazing, probably some of the best I have had in the valley. This is my new favorite close Vietnamese place, maybe soon I will try the pho since it seems to get pretty good reviews!

Delicious! Here's a picture of the food we got here. Oh wait.. it was too Good and disappeared quickly. 

Bubba is the best ever!
The Bun Bo Hue is fantastic here.  :)  The ambiance is nice, decorations are cute, and service is great.

Yeah this place is not the best for Pho... Got the Pho Gah (chicken)... never again. Bad service, boring broth, stale tasting spring rolls, dry ass chicken, and barely any vegetables to put in the Pho.  Idk what the other menu options taste like, but as far as the Pho is concerned, go somewhere else like Pho Thanh (They are cheaper and taste way better).  You can go and try this place if you want, but you could also spend your money and get a better value elsewhere..

I've been to this restaurant two times and the the pho is great. The menu at first glance seems pretty expensive, $5 for two egg rolls, appetizers, etc. But if you come during their weekday happy hour (something like M-F 3pm-5pm) the appetizers are half off, which makes them "normal" priced as far as Vietnamese joints go. What you pay for is the nice atmosphere, everything is very clean, and the decor is very nice, and modern. 

The bowls of pho are around $9-$10 which is expensive, but the bowls are actually fairly large so it evens out. My first impressions of this restaurant were that it was far too expensive to be a Vietnamese restaurant, but after seeing the large portions of pho and bun bo hue, I'd recommend this restaurant!

Hidden from the main street this cozy Pho restaurant has surprised me with warm welcoming and savory Pho. I ordered the buck-choy and I approve of their cooking.

The combination won-ton soup is to die for when mixed with lime.

The roasted duck soup is delicious and the noodles have absorbed the rotisserie roast flavor of the duck. Complimented with mushroom add hot sauce for a nice kick.

Pho is a must at this place. Customer service is nice and attentive.  I approve.

Pho-gettaboudit... not impressed, the spring rolls were over-cooked and the chicken in the pho was no bueno.  The others at my table seemed to enjoy their meal, but I think they're just used to being let down.

Also, let me stand on my soap box and announce something to all small business owners.  You don't like it when people pay with credit or debit cards?  You don't like paying that 3-4.5% fee for electronic paying customers?  Huh.  Well guess what... you should build that into your pricing!  'Cause guess what?  NO ONE likes to see a sign that they will be paying 50 cents or whatever extra just because they don't have cash.  It rubs me the wrong way almost every time - and I know I'm not the only one.  

So - in the best interest of your getting people to RETURN and RECOMMEND your place of business to others?  Get with the 21st century and suck it up - debit / credit cards aren't going anywhere.

Great place! Chin Pho was awesome, both kids loved it. I had mine with a little Thai basil, jalapeño, lime & hoisin sauce...yum! Crispy noodle stir fry was great also, gotta let the noodles soak up the sauce! Cheapest family meal we have had. Our waitress was really helpful with recommendations!

Yummy!  I ordered the Bun Bo Hue soup extra spicy.  It worked wonders on my cold, and it was delicious!  Lots of beef, pork and meatballs in it.  The spice was almost too hot, so next time I will order it just "hot".   My hubby ordered the flank and brisket pho and it was also very good.  We shared the spring rolls.  They were okay, a little greasy for my taste.  The place was closing down the following day 8/13 for a remodel.  I am counting the days until 8/21 for the re-opening.   It was a very nice friendly and clean place.  We will go back!

I can Pho-give this place for decent service.  Granted, my group of 8 was the only one around that quiet night.  My Pho was pretty good, I think I finished before everyone around the table, but I have a big mouth.  Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food or maybe it was just good company :)  I love the decor; felt like I walked into one of my old school relatives homes - tacky Asian art with a modern twist.  They have a small wine selection, wow!  Never really gone into a Pho place with a plethora of wine!  Maybe next time I feel like eating Pho and talking about my failed relationships I'll be back ;-P enjoy!

Great food! We were greater quickly upon arriving. Once we ordered, the food do not take a very long time to arrive. Food presentation is great!

4 star because the fish pond at the front is very dirty and the koi fish in there, you can barely see.
Great service, a little slow at lunch hour which is understandable. Definitely will come back for some pho

i thought i'd give this place a shot, even with the "meh" Yelp reviews. I like to be the Yelper that proves everyone else wrong! or something like that.  went at the end of the lunch rush.... and no one was at the hostess station. so i stood there for a good few minutes before being noticed and seated.

since i was planning on ordering spring rolls, i stopped by the restroom to wash my hands .... and was DISGUSTED at the squalor.  yes, i just said squalor. it was that bad. filthy. 

i had the nem nuong cuon (grilled pork sausage spring roll). it was decent, but definitely not the best i've ever had. 

i was all excited to try the bun (vermicelli noodles), because the waitress told me a i could get 1/2 chicken and 1/2 beef.... the meat was oily, sparse, and..... just lackluster, which is strange because all of the ingredients were there.... it just fell so short of the mark. 

i then proceeded to wait for 10-15 minutes for my bill. well for anyone to come pick up my empty dishes and bring my bill. AND... does this bother anyone else but me? they give you the bill in an AmEx folder thing that says "we take AmEx" and then... they tell you they don't take it. anyways, i had to wait another few minutes to have my card picked up so i could pay and get out of there. 

were there warning signs? yes, and i should have listened. such as the overall Yelp reviews were pretty bad. there were pretty much NO other Asians in the restaurant - it was filled with middle-aged businessy white-folk. And the decor was trying too hard to be upscale. sigh, so disappointing. too bad.

This place needs to seriously clean their koi pond! The musty algae stench as I'm sitting down by the hostess section is pretty gross!  Other than that the food is decent.  I wish they wouldn't charge an extra 45 cents for debit card purchases under $15.  I tip less because of this.

I give this place 4 stars, due to price.
The food is great! Have had many many things on their menu, all were good. Fresh garden rolls are my favorite.

But prices are HIGH. I only come here when I'm on an expense account.
Very flavorful Pho! Spring rolls were Awesome! Interior is super nice! Reasonable prices!

The place is clean with old school Asian decorations.  It is big for a Pho place.  The service was great.  Got soy bean milk, yum!  Got the Beef and Chicken Pho with extra noodles.  The soup base was pretty good.  The egg rolls were good too!

My mom and I came to lunch here my mom ordered a bowl of pho she took 2 bites and found a cockroach in her soup we told the waiter and he apologized and offered her a new bowl and she said no thank you and she still had to pay for her food.

Their price is not too bad. 
But the curry dish is surprisingly bad; no flavor.
Will not go back; will not recommend.
Love this place. Great pho, fast and they pack on a lot of ingredients.

Pho is way over priced for it being mediocre. Take the time to drive a few miles more into east mesa/tempe to get better pho that is more authentic. We've eaten there and it's ok but don't even brother ordering it to go as they barely give you any broth.

Pho is one my favorite lunchtime eats.  I used to work on the west side of Phoenix where there are more choices of Vietnamese restaurants.  Pho DaLat was my first venture on the east side.  It's a great location off of Kyrene and Elliot Road and is upscale compared to your typical mom and pop shops over on the west side.  Good staff and fast service.  My problem was that food was not that great.  Not bad either, but not as flavorful as I've had elsewhere.  The Pho broth was a little weak even though there was plenty of meat in the bowl.  The veggies were limited to a small handful of sprouts and some fresh basil.  I would have love to have some mint and cilantro as well other leafy greens to throw into the steaming broth.  Just a bit skimpy for my tastes.  The spring roll were decent, but again missing something..  The menu itself seemed to skimp on other Vietnamese fairs.

Anyhow, not the worst, but not the best.  I'll continue to search out for a better bowl of Pho on the East Side..  My adventure continues...

My review is for our Togo experience. 
We are used to 4 egg rolls at pho places so we're surprised there are only 2 per order. The pho portions are small, though the meat is fresh. Noodle usually heaping at other places.  Maybe 2/3 cup here.

No hoison, or Sriracha in the Togo bag, not even utensils.  Won't be back. Sorry.

Now before I go on with my review, I am originally from Northern California which is a Vietnam mecca (San Jose, CA), therefore there are pho joints on every corner. I've been to the good, the bad, and the ugly places, Pho Da Lat was somewhere in the middle. Not too bad, but OK.

I was craving some good Pho and my brother who has been living here for 9 years recommended this Pho place in town, Pho Da Lat. He praises this spot and I somewhat trust his intuition, sort of. So I gave it a try!

First off, they sell bubble drinks here (aka boba, tapioca drinks) and they were very good. You have a list of flavors to choose from and I tried their mango boba drink and it was delicious, now onto the actual Pho....

The broth, which is the main pull to my love for Pho was actually a little bland and not flavorful. Honestly, this is the foundation to a great Pho, you have a good broth, all else will be excellent! The broth was okay, nothing special. Also I didn't get receive much beef, it was actually quite sparse. My mother ordered a seafood Pho and she only had like 3 or four shrimps in hers, NOTHING. I will give them props for the spring rolls which were pretty good, I strongly recommend those if you try this place. The service was VERY good, the server was very friendly, helpful and patient! The restaurant itself was very clean and professional looking. I will go back, if my brother invites me again, lol.

This place is awesome. The wait staff is super attentive and not over bearing as well. They let me eat my meal, but also noticed when I needed something right away. The inside is so nice. The decoration really creates a nice atmosohere. I ordered the seafood pho and it was the perfect proportion. I didn't feel like I was overwhelmed with noodles and they had enough meat in it to keep me satisfied. Their boba and cafe su da (Vietnamese coffee) was delicious as well. I've been looking for a new favorite pho place and I think this might be it!!

This is some of the best vegetarian pho out there.  It is so flavorful and delicious.  The veggies you get with it are perfect.  I have been to some other places where the veggie selection in the pho is lacking, but not here.  My man (a meat-eater) even gets the veggie broth because he actually likes it better.  (He does add some rare beef to it though).

The staff is always extremely friendly and accommodating.  

Happy hour is good.  I recommend the spring rolls, which are around $3 with happy hour.

You can certainly leave here happy, full, and with money still in your wallet.
Consistent, consistent, consistent. Every time. That's all I can ask for in a restaurant. No wonder I've been ordering takeout here every week for the past year. Great spring rolls!

We came in for lunch in the middle of the week so it wasn't busy. I wanted to try it out because I've visited the town that the restaurant takes its name after in Vietnam. (Visit that town if you're ever there. Very pretty.) We were helped right away and the service was pretty standard. The lady that helped us spoke Vietnamese so that made ordering more authentic for any of you individuals that are Viet. 

The atmosphere was pretty casual as you are greeted with a small koi pond and water fountain with top 40 music playing overhead. The restaurant has many tables and booths so it's ideal for big groups. And the lighting is medium so it's not too dark. It's fairly clean inside though for a slow afternoon lunch hour, there were tables from previous patrons that were not cleaned for awhile after we got seated. 

My girlfriend ordered a vegetarian spring roll and I ordered a "Pho Dac Biet" or a pho special. It has all the meats and fillings. My first choice whenever I visit a pho restaurant for the first time. They were a little skimpy on the fresh vegetable dish for your pho. The broth was ok. And the sliced beef wasn't freshly prepared. But overall the pho was still pretty tasty. It was just enough to fill you up. We stayed there for almost a couple hours afterwards to chat and were not bothered by the staff in any way. And they kept refilling our drinks so that's a plus. So all in all, not the best pho in town but I would return to try their other authentic dishes.

Family dinners are awesome here. First time I ever tried quail and it was awesome! I always order the pork plate, and their soup always makes me feel better when I'm sick. The fish sauce that comes with it smells funny, but tastes really good. I use soy sauce to even the flavor, always on the table!

I've tried about 5 Thai places so far. I've come to a conclusion that Yellow Curry is my thing! Thats of course what I ordered. My gf got the Pho Tai. We also got the garlic Clams I think. The curry was a solid 2/5, and the Pho Tai, neither of us liked. The clams tasted great, but only about 1 of 3 clams, had something in them. They were all SHELLS! That is what really got to me, especially with the price tag for those guys. I feel as if i spent an equivalent amount of money on grade A Thai place, but had no satisfaction. I don't think I'll be coming back to this place.
Has become a twice a week lunch for me! The service is great and the pho is delicious! I wish the portions were larger, but other than that it's perfect!

This is go-to place for us for lunch. My wife loves pho and i always order combination fried-rice. It is almost like fast-food and very delicious. The pho soup is really nice and the fried rice is superb. We never had bad experience there except the service was slow(our server disappeared for a while) few times. The price is cheap and we will go there again.

Very large dining room and fairly clean.  Y husband had the Pho with brisket and flank.  I had the veggie pho and added beef.  We also had the pork spring rolls.  The flavor was good and portions large.  We would come again for the Pho.

Update 2/2016

We used to eat here weekly; not anymore.  We got a stomach bug. The service got worse and worse, our regular nice waitress left, and it was basically long faces on the folks who remained.  The place is dirty--dirty walls by the tables, with food encrusted on the walls from months ago. Super dirty floors by the entrance and below the booths. I think the kitchen is the same, but after getting a stomach bug we decided not to come back anymore.

***********

We really enjoyed our meal here.  Food was delicious and fresh and RAPIDLY PREPARED.  Very nice ambiance; well-decorated and comfortable.  Equally as good as the other Pho restaurants we've frequented here in the valley - and the price is right.  $24 for 2 people, no drinks, ate until we were full.  We will definitely be back!

There's absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. My boyfriend works nearby, and he's nice and Asian, so it's always a great place for us to meet up and grab a bite.

The Pork Vermicelli is awesome, but I stick with the traditional Pho. And, if you're in the mood for coffee, try the Vietnamese Coffee, it's got such a great twist with condensed milk.

Let me preface by saying I was born in Saigon.  I understand Pho like a redneck understands buckshot.  That's to say, both can be a total miss or to die for.  But, on average they both tend to hit the target.  People who get all worked up over whether the broth was too cloudy, or too sweet, or they got one lime instead of 2 limes need to loosen up a little about this treasured Vietnamese dish.  Pho Da Lat's pho is pretty average in a city where all pho is pretty average.  So I'm saying it's a good showing for pho in Phoenix.  So why 4 stars?  

Two reasons: 

1) The roast game hen is simply perfect.  It's not a typical dish in any Vietnamese restaurant and transports one to idyllic Provence.  Evidence of the French colonial influence.  It's charred and crispy on the edges and succulent in the meaty areas.  It's served over white rice and accompanied by cucumbers, cilantro and lettuce.  A small dish with salt/pepper & lime is for dipping.  

2) These guys have a selection of wine.  Wine with Pho unheard of you say?  Don't pair with red wines, instead pick a dry white wine.  I chose the 2009 Farrier Alexander Valley Andiron (Semillon/Sauv Blanc) $6.  The hints of lime and bright finish go perfectly with spicy Pho broth.  It's also excellent with the roast bird.  

The Pho and the Andiron are good by themselves but together they transcend.
Huge fan of this place! The service is good and the food and iced coffee is even better. Love it and highly recommend.

The pho and roasted hen are my favorites . The only turn off's here are the extra pricing to get fried rice and the portions of the fried rice they give even for dinner . 

Other wise if you go with the traditional pho you can't go wrong
The food was good. The server: Thai was very nice and kind. He had a sense of humor. I liked his attitude. Overall, this pho place is good and they have the best garden rolls I've ever tasted!

Live right around the corner, and have eaten here weekly, sometimes more, for several years.  I have a debilitating allergy issue with MSG. I have recently had issues with foods from this restaurant, the pork products, in particular.  The 'pork' in the spring rolls has clearly changed to a product ( spam?), as well as the pork used in simple dishes - pork and rice plate.  Very sad the quality of ingredients and cooking has changed. Just can't eat at one of my favorite place any longer

I am a pho phanatic, and this place hits the spot!  It's so cheap and such a great portion that I usually share with the kids.  The broth is so tasty, not overpowered by cinnamon or anise or salt.  I do miss the side of cilantro that other pho places include....But this is quick and satisfying and cheap.

My journey to find the yummiest pho is not complete, but this place is great and tops my list, especially considering it's so close to home.

Another favorite are the beef roll appetizers.  It's thin meat, marinated in like hunan sauce, filled with caramelized onions and rolled info a little finger food and served with some dipping sauce.

All the other dishes I've tried have been good, although when you say spicy it doesn't really come out "spicy".

They do charge a convenience fee for totals of $10 or less if you're paying with credit card, the staff is always friendy and the place is clean with a very low key atmosphere.  The kids love the fish pond at the entrance.
Love this place and have been coming for years! I have never had a bad meal but I mostly go for the Pho.

I'm generally easily pleased when it comes to Vietnamese food, but this was truly terrible. From the food to the service to the rudeness of the manager when I expressed my unhappiness, I left really unhappy and unsatisfied. We ordered the pork spring rolls , grilled pork vermicelli and pho with beef and meatballs. The rice paper on the spring rolls was not fresh or soft. The pork in the vermicelli bowl was tasty, but there was hardly any of it in proportion to the noodles and salad. The meatballs in the pho were rubbery and the broth was hardly a lukewarm temperature with a strange taste. When we expressed to the manager that the pho was not good, he told us it's always made with the same thing and his repeat customers like his food. He refused to take it off the bill and just kept offering to give us another bowl of pho....from the same batch. Prices are good here and the restaurant is nice, but with plenty of other vietnamese restaurants in the area that are great, I would strongly recommend against going here.

I've tried a lot of Vietnamese places and so far this is the one I keep coming back to. Everyone is in a friendly mood and the service always seem to be good, even if it's busy. 

Everything I have ever ordered has been great! This time I ordered #36, which is basically pork, rice, over easy egg, egg cake and cucumber slices. The meat was lean and marinated well. The only thing I didn't really like was the egg cake, never have... So not there fault. My friend ordered #39, grilled chicken and rice. It was her first time eating there and she loved it too. She is always picky about her food, but she was pleased with the outcome. 

So overall it was a great experience!! Plus they have my favorite, Vietnamese coffee!! =)
It was so delicious! Kevin the server was so nice and attentive. Absolutely delicious!
I've been coming here for lunch for a few years now.  Service is always fast and friendly.  Their Pho is incredible but don't pass up their rice dishes.  They are equally delicious.

Pho Da Lat was a great impromptu lunch decision on a Saturday afternoon when I had an hour or so to kill with a friend. 2pm on a Saturday almost no one was in there, which I like. 

We were immediately led to a table and given menus. The staff gave us enough time to look over our menus and think of any questions we wanted to ask in our heads first. When we finally ordered, we decided to try the quail appetizer and then each had questions on dishes. In response to my guest's questions, samples were brought out to try, which I thought was excellent.

I asked their opinion in regard to the best of the spicy flavorful dishes and it was suggested I try the lemongrass chili chicken which I did. 

Unfortunately, our food came out and our appetizer was forgotten about. However, the food was plenty and I ended up not even being able to finish it all anyway. The spice was right on par and we both seemed to enjoy our lunch there. 

I will be back again, as I found several dishes I wanted to try, which is the key to high rating and return visit with me, and hopefully next time I will try the 40+ advertised wines. All at once you ask? Hmmm... let's see where the night goes...
One of the only Pho places I go to here in the Phoenix area. Service is great, food is better!
This is now our favourite Vietnamese restaurant in Phoenix. Great service. Very friendly, efficient and helpful with the menu. Portions were large and tasty. We highly recommend it!

Ok, i am going to apologize in advance to all those nice folks who like this place - you got jeeped!!! 

This was one of the MOST unappetizing lunch i had in the looong time. Cold rice, bland chicken, non-friendly service, somewhat expensive. "Not spicy 'nogh fo' yo? I bring hot sauce!" HUH? WTF. I do not want hot sauce, i want properly prepared dish. 
I never came back and neither i intend to .

"I no like"

Eugene
This is some great Vietnamese food in the Chandler/Ahwatukee area. They have great Pho choices among many other dishes. I will definitely be coming back!

I love vietnamese food and decided to give this place a try since my favorite "hole in the wall" joint closed down. I had the steak pho, crispy spring rolls and bun (vermicelli) which were all pretty good and flavorful! The service was great, but I was a little disappointed with our drinks. My Thai iced tea was watery and the boba had a heavy flavored creamer taste to it. Overall, I will come back, but I'm still on the lookout for a new hidden gem.

Crispy spring rolls were fantastic, super crispy wrapper and awesome flavor, and plated with plenty of romaine leaves and basil.  One order came with 2 rolls, and a bit pricey at $4.95.

I love a good hearty pho, and went for the DaLat special pho.  Broth was pretty good if you enjoy it lukewarm... at least heat it up enough to wilt the basil and bean sprouts.  Besides, any respectable Pho shop would have a jar of chili oil on every table instead of having to ask for it.
My boyfriend and I love this place.  Food is great, friendly services and owner is really nice.

This place has THE BEST pho in town. The veggie broth is my favorite being a vegetarian.  I have never left here feeling dissatisfied or hungry. I highly recommend trying it out. The wait staff is always friendly and always has a smile on their faces.
My girlfriend introduced me to this place. I must say it's pretty clean and the food tastes great. I'm not always in the mood for soup but when I am this pho is great!

How weird is that. I think Tonia B. may of been sitting at the table over from us during lunch!

The rolls have improved since my last visit. They were no longer greasy, hopefully last time was a fluke. The pho was awesome. I have never had a bowl of pho with so much meat in it. This time I got the #9 which was $1 more than the rest...maybe that's why.

Anyways, it was a very good lunch!

Ate here for the first time tonight.  I enjoyed the experience, friendly staff, nice clear restaurant. I ordered the Pho Tai (Rare Beef Pho) and it was mediocre.  Not terrible but if you're craving incredible Pho this isn't the place for you.

Ok, I'll admit I wasn't super impressed the first time I got take out from this place. But after dining here a few times I have definitely become a fan. The decor is much cooler than what you would expect from the outside. They have done their best to make it look classy but still comfortable and low-key. I like the koi pond, that is pretty cool.  And the pho is much better when it is served fresh. I like the fact that they have so many different options. I had the seafood one tonight and it was very tasty and extremely filling.  As others have mentioned, their fresh spring rolls and those beef rollup thingys are winners too.

Add to all that the selection of affordable wines by the glass and tasty boba smoothies and that's it, I'm hooked. I love the fact that the menus have detailed explanations of the items so that if you aren't that familiar with Vietnamese cuisine you wont sound dumb asking a bunch of questions. The servers are all friendly, though, and seem to take pride in the place. So, I'm sure they'll answer any questions you want. :-)
Excellent Pho. #11 is great. Clean place with great service. Entrees are reasonability priced. Good all around family or date night stop.

Pho Da Lat serves up all your favorite Vietnamese dishes such as pho, spring rolls, rice dishes, and vermicelli. We had some spring rolls and I ordered a shrimp vermicelli dish. The spring rolls were excellent. They had the perfect balance of ingredients and had a light, fresh taste. 

The vermicelli was filled with the rice noodles, shredded lettuce, bean sprouts, and grilled shrimp. Overall, it was good and had a nice balance of textures and flavors and I especially enjoyed the grilled flavor of the shrimp.

The atmosphere is nice, with a koi pond and elegant decor.

I'll definitely dine here again if I'm in the area.
The Pho is delicious. They have a stage and a huge wine menu. The place is very large and always busy. Definitely a place we frequented.

We actually were surprised there was a Pho in Tempe, AZ. Of course we had to try it out. This was one of the fanciest vietnamese restaurant we've eaten in. It was very clean and I loved the seating arrangements with the booths and the ceiling was decorated with fancy lighting which dimmed the restaurant. It felt like a romantic lit dinner for my husband and I. One thing I also loved was THEY HAD HAPPY HOUR FOR APPETIZERS! (It was only for certain hours in the afternoon) who does that? THIS place of course =0)

We had two orders of fresh spring rolls that only came in 2 long rolls cut in half. I think they could of added another one, they actually don't give much. We also had an order of fried egg roll, it was delicious. The wrapper was a little different than most egg rolls. It had a bubbly crispy texture but good. Prices for the appetizers were kind of expensive, so its best to go when its happy hour.. but over all well worth it.

When you order the pho noodle soup, its always about the broth that makes a noodle soup taste good and this was really good! Had a beefy & sweet flavor to it. I had to add a little salt, but other than that, it was good! The mediums size pho bowl was pretty big, so it was just right for me. 

The waitress and staff was great. They were very prompt and friendly to us. They checked up on us every so often to make sure we were doing okay and thats what I call customer service. If only all the pho spots had manners and decorations like them, but thats what makes them stand out! Sooo Pho Dat!!!

I tried this for the first time last week.  I was VERY happy.

Having lived in Asia for a few years, it was great to find a Vietnamese place with good flavor.  Portions were good, broth was piping hot and tasty, and the peppers and condiments made for excellent authenticity. Downright delicious to say the least...

I had the sliced beef pho BTW.   I will be returning and I can recommend it with two thumbs up.

Super yummy Thai restaurant. I played it safe and had the pho, which was delicious. The spring rolls were a table pleaser. My companions had nothing but good things to say about their dishes. Good value for the money. Service was a little slow, but you have to expect that when it's busy. We will be back.

My friend really wanted some Pho so we found this place on yelp. Not a great decision. The prices are decent and the food was nice. The service was horrible. The waiter rotate between staring at us, playing with other coworkers, and hiding from us in the back. We askdd for oyster sauce and it took him like 10 minutes to bring it to us. We were the only table that he had.

Brought my family here the other night for dinner.  The Pho broth was on point.  Flavorful.  The rice dish, their "special" I believe, was not particularly tasty for us or our kids.  

The reason for the 3, and not 4 starts, is the price.  A regular bowl of Pho costs you somewhere between $10-12.  Couple that with an order of spring rolls or other entrees for the family, and you wonder whether a night out for Pho should be costing that much.

Always in search for Pho. I tried this place with a friend for a late lunch. Our waiter was excellent, very friendly, very attentive. We ordered appetizer #1Crispy Spring Rolls (pork, mixed veggies) served with lettuce, mint, fish sauce and #2 Fresh Garden Rolls (shrimp, pork, mint, bean sprouts, rice noodles), both were very good. Oh course we ordered Pho, #14 Tendon & Tripe Pho and #9 Easy Rare Pho both served with condiment vegetables. The Pho was very good, fresh ingredients, the broth was prefect. My only comment would be more meat and tripe please. Other than that.

Excellent service, good food for a great price. I'll be back.

Oh, where to begin. While the food we had was good, the service, though friendly, was just atrocious! Not only did they....bring out the entree's first (Bun) and forget the garden rolls, they gave the wrong dishes to each, brought the dipping sauce for the appetizer we didn't get, told her to bring fish sauce for each of our Bun bowls, brought only one out, had to get another, had to ask for chopsticks, hoisan sauce and chili sauce. On the bright side, the bowls were very tasty and fresh. However, another gripe is the very high prices. I've eaten Vietnamese food at dozens of places and this was by far the priciest. A Vietnamese iced coffee was $4.50 that was maybe 25 cents worth of ingredients. Most other places it's $2-2.50 tops! You get a small, maybe three-four ounces of coffee dripping into a glass with sweetened condensed milk. Literally filled the glass of ice only half full. The Bun, which usually costs between $4-6 no matter where you go, was $10.95 to $12.50! Insane. Our waitress asked if we wanted separate checks, which we did, and when the check came, both receipts were wrong. The woman sitting next to us was also taking her waiter to task for bringing her the wrong dish twice. This seems to be a pattern here. At these prices, they need to raise the level of their service.

This is a good Pho place with average Pho, average atmosphere, decent service, and very clean. Not my favorite but close to home. Perfect for lunch as Pho is about $6 a bowl. Dinner is a bit pricey. Been here several times and always a good honest bowl of Pho. Egg rolls are pretty good too. Spring rolls are really good.
Loved this place. Food was fresh and delicious. Would definitely recommend for Someone looking for a good Vietnamese restaurant in Tempe

Highly recommended!  I ate pho combination. First, the broth so tasty but light. And service was amazing, fast, friendly. 
Then I ordered to go tofu fried spicy chef specialty (I think). It was awesone!!!

Good pho and friendly service.  Great wine selection as well, good prices even off of happy hour.  That being said this place would be a  steal during HH, looking forward for an opportunity to go back, a little far from where I live but a great spot for sure.  One question: Did this place exist as a former night club?  What is with all of the dance and DJ equipment?? This would be a great place to be introduced to Vietnamese food as I was years back.

I am of Vietnamese blood. I was, however, born in the USA. I grew up eating my parents' Vietnamese food and am used to real Vietnamese food. That being said, Pho Dalat has some of the realest Vietnamese food I have had on the East Valley of Arizona. 

I have only had their Pho, but it is spectacular. Fresh tasting broth, noodles that looked like it just came out of the boiling pot, nice cuts of meat, you name it. Really good portion to price ratio. The value is really good on this Pho. Can't speak for the other dishes though. 

The service is also good. Yeah, it takes a little while to get your food to you, but it's worth the wait. The owner is very nice. The wait staff are friendly, but not in a fake way. 

Overall, I would recommend this place. Food is great and service is nice.

Fantastic Pho and service. I went during off hours so it wasn't busy, not sure how things are during busy hours. 

Staff was very knowledgable too.

Would give this place 0 stars but that wasn't an option... The first indication of something wrong was that the place was empty, I think there were 3 other tables being waited on. The food is more expensive then other pho places I've been to. They also don't offer a kids bowl of pho. The food was ok. I ordered oxtails which were $14 but only had 4 miniscule pieces of oxtail the flavor was light but good. The worse part was that my daughter ordered a bowl of pho and they never brought it out to her, my husband and I were nearly finished and still no pho for my child (she was eating off of my husbands plate) we asked our waiter and he said he thought we ordered something in place of the pho (which never happened) he brought out the pho and I asked if the restaurant would cover the pho because we all were done and my daughter still wanted the pho. He said "You ordered it you can pay, or we can take it" I asked for the manager, she came out but she didn't speak much English. When I finished explaining what happened she ended up communicating the same thing our waiter stated. They never took ownership of the mistake or tried to make things right. After that exchange we sat and waited another 30 mins while our daughter finished her food. We left having spent $60 on mediocre food and horrible customer service. My family will never come back!

I've eaten here six times in the past year and can say that the quality of food and service has been consistent each time. Standard fare as far as Pho is concerned. I have not eaten here for lunch but dinner portions have been enough to take home for a second meal.

The spicy beef vermicelli is very good if you aren't in the mood for Pho. You can choose from 1-5 for the level of spice in the dish. If you like it hot then 4 is very good but I don't think a 5 would cause much trouble if you're feeling risky. Also, the garden spring rolls are worth getting if only for the peanut dipping sauce that accompanies them. 

Altogether a good place with a nice atmosphere and attentive service.

------
Update Feb '13:
Five years later and I'm still a regular. The Combination Bun Tom has quickly become a summer favorite and the pho supplies me with a warm soup fix on "cold" (Phoenix cold) days. I'll even stop by and purchase a big container of pho broth to sip on if I'm feeling under the weather. I'm happy have this place in the area since good asian food is generally reserved for Mesa and I'm not alway in the mood for that trek!
Great Pho. Well above average. But not really super over the top great. Just very good. Great service.

I have been here a few times it's always been good. I went there Friday and got my usual number 8 Pho special... Well as I was eating I saw a piece of hair in my bowl I was done.. I let the waiter know and I love that they did just brush it off. He told the manager and they took the bowl off my bill and offered me a new one togo. Most places will just have a oh well that sucks attitude, but the way they handled it I will still go there and eat. Thank You!!!
Service was crappy........they sat us way in the back corner while everyone was up front.... they barely paid any attention to us . Only reason it has two stars is because the Thai tea was good

I used to work near here and used to come all the time. I stopped coming because I found a new spot for Pho but my new spot shut down so now I'm back. 

I used to love their Shrimp fried rice but I can really tell they don't put the time in it like they used to. The rice was hard and there was really no seasoning. They give you about 4-5 shrimp and they are huge really wish they would cut them down a little smaller. As for the Pho, it's pretty good but I've definitely had better. I always have to ask for more sprouts and lemon because they just don't ever give enough. I will be back because this the still the closest place for Pho by my new work but I'm only giving 3 stars.  :-)

Never disappointed. Everything about this place rocks! They are very accommodating to dietary needs and every meal is exceptional. They have a band that plays on the weekends. Great for groups or date nights.

While our waiter, I think his name was Kevin, offered great service and was friendly and helpful, I was just very unimpressed with the food. 

It should be noted that we were a group of 16 people, so things were a bit hectic for them. I ordered the Hainan Chicken and it took the longest to come out, after everyone got their pho and spring rolls. The chicken was dry and wasn't that good. The rice, although flavorful, was also dry. 

My friend ordered Hu Tieu Xao (Flat rice noodles stir fry) and they brought out the wrong order and gave her Mi Hu Tieu (Clear Noodles Soup). After some more confusion and discussion, they brought out her Hu Tieu Xao but it was nothing like what we knew that dish to be. I finally realized that it must be a regional recipe since we were at Pho Da Lat, which is a region in Vietnam. 

I took the Hi Tieu Xao on my tab so she could order something else and took it home. While it was flavorful, the noodles were all broken and not quite appetizing.

However, while I did not taste their pho, it did smell wonderful. The other members of our party that ordered pho did say that the pho is pretty good, but they didn't give enough noodles. 

Considering that their prices were on the higher end of most Pho places, their food wasn't that impressive. Aside from the good customer service we received from our waiter, nothing else stood out to me and I don't think I would come back here.

I stopped in because I had a class in the area and a friend had also given Pho Da Lat the thumbs up. Ordered meatball and tendon pho. Just tasting the broth before adding anything - it was very good (dinner service). Next I tried a meatball - there's something different about the meatball, it was dense but had a full meatiness - what I mean, is some pho meatballs have a lot of gristle in them. This one did not. Added the usual suspects - it was a great bowl. Took home leftovers and was even better reheated.  Sorry no picture - but if you're pho eater, you're mouth should be watering!

I have been coming to this place for a while now. I love coming here for a glass of wine and a big bowl of pho. All the dishes I have tried here are flavorful and priced just right. The restrooms are decorated beautifully and are always clean. The staff is always friendly and willing to answer any questions on the menu. I highly recommend this place for a relaxing yummy dinner.

A notch above Pho Nhat but overall wasn't wowed by anything here
(The ambiance here is a lot better though then the divey pho spots around town)

The veggies that accompany the crispy rolls here are pretty good though!
Pho was cheap and filling though my only complaints here was it could have used more meat served rarer~
The broth is still just ok, but the tendon is awesome!  Huge, tender, and meaty.

Stopped in for a quick bowl of Pho at the Spring Roll Factory only to be greeted by a sign on the door saying we are closed permanently. Since I had a mad craving for Pho I utilized my trusted Yelp app for another spot locally and ran across Pho Da Lat located less than 3 miles away. I am so glad I stopped in here.  This will be my new local, close to home Pho spot. Service was prompt, the fried rolls delish, spring rolls delish and the Pho was OUTSTANDING. The broth was flavorful, the veggies fresh I have no complaints. I will definitely return.
The easy rare pho and garden rolls are delicious. The lunch special is a great deal and filling.
Delicious!  We really enjoyed their pho & spring rolls.  They are actually open later than yelp says on weekends!

I have to give this 5 stars. 
This is a great little place - the service is always excellent, (friendly, quick and helpful). The owner is often to be seen walking around and chatting to his clients and can explain a lot about the dishes.
The ambiance is very nice with a good "fung shui" about it. The fish in the waterfall and pool at the entrance are gettingquite big now.

Tonite we had a starter veggie garden rolls,  1 x veggie noodle soup, 1 x spicey shrimp dish with rice and 2 x tiger beers for approx  $29. The owner threw in a free Tiger beer since we told him we hadn't seen the coupons in the Az Republic.... I took the shrimp dish with a level 5 spice - so it had me sweating a bit. My wife on the other hand likes her dishes very mild - and they are always able to suit her taste.

My wife has a sensitive tum to msg and such things and so has difficuly eating at some chinese or asian  restaurants without getting stomach-aches. However she never has a problem here and she loves the veggie noodle soup. The bowl is rather large so she never gets thru it all.

The veggies they use are all very fresh and the flavors are great. 

We have been to this place at least once a month for the last 6 - 9 months and the service and food quality have remained excellent.

highly recommended

1st time here & I already love it. The service is quick. The waitress I had was bubbly, kind and personable. She checked on me twice & gave me thumbs up after she asked if I wanted to use chopsticks & I said "Ofcourse ". The prices are totally well priced & the place is very clean and represents the culture in an elegant way.

The service was incredible! The waitress was attentive to my needs. I ordered the crispy egg rolls and they were packed with meat. I also had the #15, Pho dish with beef and meatballs. It was well seasoned and delicious. I would highly recommend the food and this place. The ambiance is wonderful too. There is Asian decor all around and even three flat screen TVs. The music was American which I disliked. There should have been Vietnamese music.

I come here very often because its the only Pho place within 15 minutes of where i live. It hits the spot now more than before, they mustve changed chefs or recipes. Been coming here for over a year and I have nothing to really complain about. The service is whatever, theres a waiter there that can have an attitude (we've seen him talk back to a customer), but the girls are always nice. 
Takes about 5-7 min to receive the Pho order, you can easily come here on an hour lunch from work. 

Pho43 express will always be the best place in the valley but this place is pretty good too!

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

Let me just start by saying the pho here is fine.  It's pretty good.  But when compared to all the other pho out there in Arizona and California, I can't quite get it to even 4 stars.

First, a bowl of pho here costs about a buck more than most other places.  A buck, in relation to the cost of pho generally, is pretty substantial.  The broth is typically less flavorful than other places, though it is a very clean broth.  The bowl is a little smaller, meaning you get just a little less of everything (and when you get a pho dac biet, a little less of everything is noticeable.)  The spring rolls, also smaller, a little heavy on the noodle filling.  

I've had a couple other random dishes from here which have been fine, but again, nothing outstanding, which is the general vibe of the entire place, thus the 3-star review.

I have to say they've really stepped up their customer service. Their food has always been a 5 star rating but they just needed some help with their service. It's vastly improved and I would have to rerate them to 5 stars.

This is after numerous visits back after some time off. I couldn't resist because the food is that good. 

Also for those vegetarians out there. Vegetable Pho with a veggie broth is something to try. I'm no vegetarian but Wow is it good. 

For those thinking of trying this place out, it's well worth the trip out here. The beauty of it, they make the dish any way you like as well. Different noodles, different meats, mic and match till your hearts (and stomachs) content!

This place has delicious food. I've been to a fair number of Pho places, though I am no expert, but this place is my favorite by far. Initially I came here on a lunch break with co-workers and since then I've been back with them, with family, and friends. The Pho broth is tasty, the selection of meats is nice and the serving is huge! The rolls they have as an appetizer are great as well. But since first trying it with my b/f my favorite thing on the menu is the delicious Ginger Clams, man they are good! My friend May always gets the vietnamese coffee with the condensed milk and I love their Thai iced tea.

I always leave full and happy, everytime I visit. Plus not long ago they did some major renovating and the place looks really cool and fresh. Totally recommend, 5 stars!

This place is totally hit or miss!  I've worked in the area for many years and love when new places pop up in the area... I've been going to Pho Da Lat for about the past year and have to say that in the beginning it was great... superior service, quick and tasty food and priced right!  However, my last three experiences... not so good!  After the first two I should have known better!  Generally my coworker and I get the same thing... Veg garden roll and peppered tofu to share... The last time we ate in this is what we ordered.... suffice it to say the server was not very gracious that we were sharing the dish and asked if we wanted the dinner portion instead (never been asked this before and we've ordered the same thing probably a dozen times in the past year!)  We agreed thinking that maybe that's what we had previously been given.  It was not.  Hmmm... same size as we had always gotten but more expensive when the check came!  Oh wait,  not to mention when she brought the dish out it was not what we had ordered and literally had to get up from the table and walk back to the kitchen (after a 10 min wait) to have the dish corrected (brought shrimp when we ordered tofu.)  Needless to say... not a great experience!!!
So last week I had a serious craving for the veg garden rolls! Just those... nothing else! So decided to call in an order and go pick it up... Called the number that I got from google...  Oops not the right number, actually seemed like someone's cell phone but he must work there since he was nice enough to provide me the right number.  Anyway, called the right number, placed my order and was told that it should be ready in 5 min... Great! Left work and went right over there... Got there in probably closer to 10 min... order not ready... not a problem... glad to be out of the office... I can wait... Order ready, and I hand the host my card... he gives me a funny look and asks if I have cash.  Nope, not on this day.  Hmmm... could have told me on the phone that I needed cash... Dontcha think???? Apparently not... Never had a problem using my card here before  but I guess we always met the min.  So figured... OK I'll order the peppered tofu and throw it in the fridge at work and have it for dinner.... Still not enough!  Actually had to add a to go tea on to the bill so he would run the freaking card!  
I won't be going back anytime soon considering that the peppered tofu was completely over spiced and undercooked and in generally just a really bad experience... Even if it means not having Vietnamese for lunch occaisionally... I'll survive!
Skip this place... You never know what your going to get!

Another ethnic food checked of my list . . . I am no longer a Vietnamese food virgin any more . . . okay . . . at least not a Pho virgin any more . . . and I was truly delighted by the pho.

First, the ambience in this place was above what I was expecting for another strip mall restaurant . . . which raised my expectations to a little higher standard.

Started of with the Spicy Mussels . . . my waitress said I could have them from a hotness scale of 1 to 5 . . . so to be safe . . . I chose 3 . . . the spiciness was just perfect for me and the overall presentation was great . . . however . . . next time I am going to try them at a 4.

For my entrée, I ordered the Pho Da Lat Special Pho . . . it came out hot and the noodles and proteins were tender and delicious . . . again . . . I did not add any extra sauces . . . preferring to enjoy the pho as presented . . . however . . . I might had a little hoisin sauce next time.

My only regret was not trying what looked like a smoothie that I noticed some people completing their meal with . . . oh well . . . there is always next time . . . and yes . . . there will definitely be a next time . . .

Pho Da Lat is an amazing place!!  I LOVE the Seafood Pho with beef broth (add a lil Hoisin and Sriracha for extra spice)...SO YUMMY!

The service is always fantastic as well.  I go there often for lunch...I suggest YOU do the same - if you can!

Was very disappointed in this location. Love pho and am accustomed to large servings, tender chicken, lots of toppings. Boyfriend and I decided to only purchase one bowl (due to high prices) and share but had no flavor, chicken was dry, and very few toppings. Service was the worst as no one ever came to refill our waters or check on us once food arrived. Won't waste money here again, better pho within area for better prices and service.

Ordered some Pho Ga and summer rolls to go the other night.  Yummy broth and lots of chicken.  The summer rolls were fresh, and the peanut sauce was yummy.  I am spoiled with Pho having lived in Seattle and Portland the past several years (rainy cities have the best pho), but really.. I was impressed. I will be back!!
Mediocre taste but they are asking for high price for a bowl of noodle soup. I would not return.

We fell in love with Pho in San Francisco, where we found it Gluten Free for my daughter who has Celiac Disease.  The owner made Gluten Free Pho and ensured no cross contamination.  She was aslo able to eat the spring rolls but, not the peanut sauce.  We  all liked our respective Pho.  We had great personal service.  We'll be back.

Mi La Kai soup on the side with tripe instead of fried fish meat balls are my favorite. Service is always excellent.

I must have it at least once a week.

Lunch prices and dinner prices vary!

Pho at lunch is $6.99-7.99 and for dinner it's $8.95-9.99

I live very close to here, but do not come here as much as my to go to Vietnamese restaurants. Not really sure why.

Location is clean and organized. Prices are fair. Service is good. Food is delicious!

I should come here more often!
The broth of their pho is delish! One of the best I've had in the East Valley! The staff is also super nice!
Clean place , service is okay just the food comes out to slow and sometimes chefs take off early so you can't get certain dishes on the menu !! Was kind of disappointed

This was our first experience at this Vietnamese place.  As I've mentioned in other postings, we are not from this area, so we rely heavily on reviews, word-of-mouth, etc., so I use this app a lot.  The reviews say that the pho is good here, but we didn't get the pho.  We opted for the Bun instead, which is vermicelli noodles.  We both ordered the number 28 and it was amazing....noodles, and grilled chicken with the sauce on the side....yum!  Can't wait to go again!!

Was out on this side of town and had a craving for some Vietnamese. Looked on Yelp and this was the closest place. 
Ordered spring rolls and bun xeo and my dad ordered the seafood soup. Soup was pretty tasty. Bun xeo was crispy and filled with goodies. Spring rolls were fresh and good amount of filling. 
Service could have been better but still good. I want to come back and try the beef pho.

I need pork blood in my bun bo hue! Step up Da Lat! Also, your spice scale is wack, I requested a 5 out of 5 on the spicy scale (also strange because I have never been asked this at a pho joint), and you sent me home with some mild ass little kid shit. 

Overall, very good though. The hostess who took my to go order was a little sassy, and I appreciate that. My broth was legit even though it was lacking in spice. Whatevs, you can always spice it up to suite your needs. My order was ready very quickly, but prices were slightly on the high side. I probably won't return even though this is the closest pho to my house. My other spot flips a better product for less money. One Love-

Good flavors and great portions. We had the country pork chops and the vercimelli, both super tasty. We started with an order of eggrolls, they were delicious and full of flavor. Service was ok but the food made up for it. We will definitely come back.

Food is delicious...the service??? not so much but I guess it depends on the waitress. I had the chicken pho and shrimp spring rolls it was delicious! The lunch menu has pretty reasonable prices. I plan on returning..hopeful a waitress who likes her job will attend me next time around:)

Great pho spot in the Valley! I can't speak to their other items because I've literally only had the pho every time I've been there. I get the veggie pho with beef broth, it's really flavorful and obviously super filling. If you're into appetizers, I like the crispy spring rolls. 

Lunchtime can be busy, but it seems like luck of the draw sometimes. We went in today at noon and had no trouble getting seated and getting our food quickly. 

Servers are friendly and interior is clean and spacious.

We walked in the door and was greeted by no one.  After about a 4-5 minute wait, someone from the kitchen finally appeared and sat us in a booth.  

My wife ordered the seafood pho and I got the meatball pho both complimented by a couple glasses of water.  Now, I can't really say whether or not the pho was good or bad as this was our first time eating it.  It was pretty flavorful but the "meatballs" were far from what I'm used to.  Also, my wife was upset they used imitation crab as opposed to real crab, but still enjoyed it.

Service at this place is lacking.  Water glasses went empty and the servers kept walking by us and not refilling.  I had to track someone down who wasnt our server to ask for a refill.

We won't be back.

Pro:
Lovely ambiance, and Service staff. Felt like and upper end restaurant, something which typical Vietnamese restaurants do not offer

Cons:
Well the food was insipid and bland. The pho tasted like salted water with a touch of broth. The condiments like sweet basil etc were dry and flaccid. I would hope that Nam pla was a default accoutrement for most authentic Vietnamese restaurants. I counted 3 meatballs and a few slivers of the rare beef pieces. The quantity was smaller than most other ones I have tasted in the area. Ah well I don't feel too bad as I can trundle on down to Saigon Pho for the better deal and food

I don't know what it is about Pho, but I feel like the more simple and grungy a pho place is, the better it is. This place is really nice looking. Right away I was worried. I came with some coworkers and had some fresh rolls, spring rolls, and pho ga. The fresh rolls and spring rolls were tasty, especially paired with the peanut sauce. The pho was a bit bland. The price was higher than I usually expect for pho. I wouldn't run back here, but it wasn't bad.
One of the better places for Pho. I wasn't a fan of it at the beginning of the year but the rare brisket pho is good here and the employees are friendly

I have ordered Bun Bo Hue, Spicy Beef Noodle Soup with Vietnamese pressed ham with thick pasta.  The broth was properly seasoned (I have asked for a 4 stars in spiciness out of 5) and it was delightful.  The flavor has a hint of lemongrass along with other herbs and spices which are essential building block of the soup.  It is NOT authentic but a very successful creation without all the grease.  The Vietnamese Coffee is in par with other places in town.  I have asked the bean sprouts to be cooked on the side and they were very happy to comply with my request..Will return soon and try their other items on the menu soon

We stopped by here because we were out shopping and this was a convenient place. The food was very mediocre and I'm disappointed by the pricing. The service was fine and restaurant was clean. It was really slow and quiet through the whole lunch hour on a Saturday. I won't be coming back here

This is the first time I had Pho in my life, so my review may not be perfect, but I wanted to write anyway about the experience. On a rainy Saturday evening, we were craving something hot and wholesome. After driving down to Paradise Cafe and discovering they were closed (who closes at 8 on a Saturday night??!) and then to Whole Foods and finding their food counter full of the day's last leftovers, we headed to Pho Da Lat. 

Not a bad  choice at all! The waiter was really attentive and our orders came really fast. It could be because the restaurant was almost empty. It was good we didn't order appetizers because then I'm sure we would have needed doggy bags. I got the well-done beef shank pho and my friend got the Pho Da Lat special. Our orders came in huge bowls, filled with steaming hot liquid, meat, and veggies, with a side of a few bean sprouts, a lemon wedge and some basil leaves, and of course Hoisin sauce and hot sauce. I'm glad I went easy on the sauce because the pho was so hot (not spicy hot...temperature hot) it made my eyes water. Well, as I said it was my first time having pho, so I don't really have anything to compare it with. But boy, was it delicious! It filled me up,, and it was healthy...so yayyyy pho!
Best Vietnamese food in it's price class for the Phoenix Valley.

I have been coming here for years and it's still one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the Phoenix area. I usually order either the Pho Tai Bo Vien (noodle soup with sliced beef and beef meatballs) or the Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (vermicelli with grilled pork and fried egg roll). Food is consistently good and hits the spot when you are craving some delicious Vietnamese food.

It's true that service is at a slower pace. You can go for a whole meal and probably only see your server 3 times, but I don't mind this as I hate when servers are constantly hovering or interrupting your meal to ask you if everything tastes good. Plus I am never in a hurry when I go here, so I don't mind waiting a little longer to get the check at the end of the meal.

I also think the decor is classy and the lighting is intimate, but not too dark that you can't see the food or the menu. It's a good place to take a date because it's usually not too crowded or loud and you can easily hold a conversation.

I've never noticed the extra credit card charge other revieweres mentioned, but I guess I've never had a check under $10 before. I kind of like that you have the option of paying less if you bring cash though. Saves money for both the customer and restaurant owner!

Always great pho! I go here all the time and the pho is always on point. The pork vermicelli is always excellent as well. Come to think of it, I've enjoyed everything I've ever ordered from this place!

I was pretty excited to try this place and what a let down.

I had ordered the bun bo hue and had thought my waitress brought out the wrong dish since there wasn't any pork blood or pork knuckles. Turns out that this place is just an Americanized pho restaurant that doesn't carry pork blood. Ugh. I should have read the menu more closely. My bad.

The dish itself was disappointing. The noodles used had an odd texture and were super soggy. It didn't hold the flavor of the broth at all and seemed like they either overcooked it to death or reboiled leftover noodles from the day before (which is likely since they just opened up on the Sunday when we went). Minus the liberal use of hot oil as their preferred method of heat, the broth didn't have much depth or flavor. What a pity. This was my first meal back in town after an incredible weekend in the bay area! I did like the slices of the Vietnamese ham though.

Service is okay and the place is clean. They do seem to cater to a more Americanized clientele though. I won't be back.

I was craving pho this weekend, so I turned to my trusty Yelp to help guide me to my salvation.  Enter: Pho Da Lat.  First, the interior is very nicely decorated.  A little water feature at the entrance with live koi swimming around, and very tastefully placed Asian decorations throughout.  

My daughter ordered the spring rolls and I ordered the summer rolls to start, which provides me with my only criticisms from my visit.  It took more than 10 minutes to bring out our rolls -- and in fact, my daughter's fried spring rolls came out BEFORE my raw summer rolls!  I'm not sure if they had to drive to the nearest body of water to catch the shrimp in my rolls or what, but it took waaaaaay too long to bring out some simple rolls.  The summer rolls themselves were just okay, not as good as Maxim or Sekong by Night.  

For our meals, I ordered the seafood pho (minus the fish balls) and my daughter ordered the curry chicken.  The broth of my pho was absolutely delicious!  It was flavorful and tasty, and I will definitely be going back for more!  It included crab, calamari and shrimp.  My daughter also enjoyed her curry chicken, although I wasn't that impressed with it when I tasted it, but, to each his own!

All in all, a good experience, and I'll be going back for more seafood pho.  But they just need to speed up service a bit.

My bf and I landed in Phoenix from DC and decided to stop by here for dinner before heading back to Tucson.  I ordered the bun bo hue (spicy beef noodle soup). They have 1-5 of spicy level, which 1 is the lowest spicy and 5 is the most spicy. I went with the 5 because I love spicy food and especially  when it comes to bun bo hue. 

The broth and noodles cooked perfectly but it missing some stuff such as pork blood and pork feet, but overall I think it's the best bun bo hue  I ever ate in arizona. The spicy level was perfect for me and also it's not over powering. I love the Vietnamese ham that they put in there and the veggies were all fresh. 

The service was nice. Our waiter came to our table to check on us from time to time to see if we need anything else. The restaurant was clean and well organized. I would definitely recommend here if they want to find a decent Vietnamese restaurant. I am looking forward to come back to try other dishes on the menu.

Good pho, good soup, and good service! I'd been craving pho for a few days now and this place definitely hit the spot! The server was really nice and even brought me a dish of chili I asked for. It's a pretty relaxed atmosphere and they even have real koi fish in their pond! I will definitely come back and bring my friends =)

Food was flavorful...service was good...host polite and delightful to see..order came out extremely quick..it's my first time trying pho from somewhere but hey...I am completely satisfied..and I get ticked easily when food I pay for isn't good..good job staff...you will see me plenty

I never tire of a deliciously hot bowl of Pho from this place. This service is efficient and the food tastes so very fresh. The veggie pho is my favorite along with the soft appetizer spring rolls. My son usually gets the beef pho or one of the fried rice dishes and we have never been disappointed. Good lunch crowd every single day of the week. Yummy.

I stopped by for lunch during my work day and was pleased with the atmosphere and service. The grilled chicken rice plate was delicious and a well priced alternative to nearby fast food options. The Vietnamese Iced Coffee is a must try!

The restaurant is very well decorated with lots of booths and tables for seatings. Service is decent and there are plenty of parking in the lot. 

Wow! Their spring rolls are truly delicious. We ordered the fried spring roll as well as the rice paper spring roll (#1 and #2 on their menu - sorry I forgot the names), they are both super delicious!!!! The egg roll with cold noodles. Unfortunately it was a bit tasteless even after I add half a bowl of fish sauce in it. For drink, I ordered a fresh coconut. It was very small but sweet with lots of juice in it. 

I couldn't think of a better place for lunch and will definitely come back here again.

Disappointed!

It used to be a 5 star place fore me...it's slowly going down hill. The portion sizes are down. I love to order their pepper tofu...I am getting a lot more rice that I used to...but the portion of the curry went down. So, I feel like I am eating just steamed rice. 

Secondly... I heard a few complaints from my friends and ignored them... but I too had a rotten red bell pepper in my pepper tofu. Now I see the trend. Used to be a great place.
